author: {'steamid': '76561198098325894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 179, 'playtime_forever': 328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1703680952}
review:
This is one of those in between a thumbs up and thumbs down games. This has the same gameplay (more or less) as their action unleashed U title, but either I don't remember that game correctly, or Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is just about worse in every way.

The gameplay is pretty basic for an action game. There isn't much variety in terms of the main combos, but each character has a plethora of special attacks taken from the main Hyperdimension games. Though the weaker ones don't have any indication of when you can use them or not. 
It took me three quarters into the game to figure out how to use items, and you have to use them in real time, which makes it pretty tough, since you're typically surrounded by enemies. 

 Pretty much every time you attack leaves you wide open, and there is no invincibility after being hit, so enemies can rack up hits on you pretty easily, and you die very quickly to boot.

That being said, the game isn't that hard. In fact, for the most part, it's pretty dang easy. I probably only failed missions four times on some tougher bosses that take a billion hits to kill.

My biggest problem with the game is how clunky it is to upgrade stats. It takes so many clicks or button presses and a bit of guesswork to upgrade your characters. I don't know who designed it that way, but shame on them.

You can fuse items. The game never explains what that does, and I never tried it, so have at it!

In conclusion, the game isn't good, but it isn't bad. It's ultimate saving grace is the story is 4-5 hours long. It's a goofy, not-so-good story, but whatever. There's other things to do outside of the campaign, so if you do enjoy the game, you can play some co-op or whatever.

I bought this on a very low sale price, so for that, I can say it was absolutely worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561199088050965', 'num_games_owned': 1525, 'num_reviews': 494, 'playtime_forever': 10, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1702438646}
review:
This game king of feels like babies first Dynasty warriors with a neptune theme.

Pros:
- Easy smash and bash power
- The different combat styles of each character keep it interesting
- Easy to pick up and put down

Cons:
- Very very easy as you start
- They don't explain some of the mechanics as well as they could have
- Hard to find folks to play online witrh (or at least when I tried)

It's an ok game, with a lower price point and i feel you get what you pay for.

review:
It's honestly difficult to recommend this game. The core gameplay is somewhat okay and relatively enjoyable I guess (also it's a Neptunia game, so hey ho), but man are the loading times a pain, and there are loading screens EVERYWHERE*. This is WITH an SSD even. If you're willing to put up with that, go ahead and get this I guess, but otherwise, avoid like the plague.

(* not as bad as something like Sonic '06, but it's still enough to make me drop the game after a few play sessions)

author: {'steamid': '76561199147230102', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2976, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2976, 'last_played': 1697789027}
review:
[h1] Story [/h1] (7/10)
I think the story of this game is a bit difficult to understand. It started with a group of girls who wanted to make a film about zombies. Directed by Blanc (White Heart), I think it's okay, but what's strange is when they want to make a zombie film but players are told to kill real zombies. From start to finish the story makes a zombie film, but the gameplay actually kills zombies. until there is a sequel to the story to fight boss zombies. In my opinion, Tamsoft should improve its game in terms of story structure.


[h1] Graphic [/h1] (8/10)
The characters of this game are quite good and are covered with typical Neptunia graphics whose quality is beyond doubt. what I like is the boss character, which I think is good and cool. It would only be better if there were new characters added. Maybe because this isn't the main game, Tamsoft can't create new characters without Idea Factory's permission


[h1] Gameplay [/h1] (8/10)
The gameplay of this Tamsoft game carries an action RPG style that utilizes the evade and block functions. I especially like this kind of gameplay, because this kind of gameplay makes the game more challenging and difficult to finish. Moreover, if you add an open world theme to this game, it will definitely be even more challenging to finish.


[h1] Sound [/h1] (8/10)
I think the soundtrack of this game is good. The zombie theme matches the tone of the zombie songs in this game. So when we play the spin off game from Neptunia, it's not surprising that we will see a new soundtrack from the original one.

[h1] DLC [/h1] (7/10)
Because this is a spin off game, there isn't much DLC in this game, so I can't really comment much.

review: This game is somewhat similar to Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed and it was one of the best hack and slash game that I ever played so this means MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is also one of the best hack and slash game that I ever played.

author: {'steamid': '76561198152669078', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1698040930}
review:
This is easily the most fun spin-off game ever, I never in my life would've guessed that you have to learn combos in a Neptunia game in a way like you need to in Mortal Kombat, The story is wacky, silly, and goofy in a good way and you decide how different scenes play out so I guess in a sense this is also a Choices Matter game. To be honest I like both main Nep titles and spin-off titles, but spin-off titles can't seem to dissapoint me (except Super Neptunia RPG) and I love how IF/Compile Heart take this franchise into many genres such as platformer, shooter, real life wave fight, hack and slash, RPG, JRPG etc. 

If you are a Neptunia fan definetely buy this, if not this is good enough to make you invested in the Neptunia universe. :3

author: {'steamid': '76561198031582331', 'num_games_owned': 6781, 'num_reviews': 768, 'playtime_forever': 351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 351, 'last_played': 1688987481}
review:
Neptune games are very bare bones and are only enjoyable is you REALLY like anime school girls. they are fully voice acted and give a bit of fan service so if thats your thing you'll love the nep out of this series. for anyone else just looking at this for gameplay there is a decent game here but it gets mind numbing fairly fast so unless your down with braindead fun you can can skip this.

this is a hack and slash game where you pic 2 fighters and 2 support girls. you'll run up to the enemy spawn points and slash, use specials, call on your support, use your transformation, or even use tag team moves to smash enemies and bosses into items. you can get outfits (they all have a ripped one), weapons, and even side items. i'm actually impressed with the side items placement. i got some sunglasses and i could place them almost anywhere on the girls and all these items worked this way. 

i feel the story and gameplay are bland but there are people who would really loving this game. if you like Neptune look into the Sakura series because they seem like they are for the same group of people but neptune is 3d as sakura is 2d (and are a bit more adult).

Still enjoyable 

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 741, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 741, 'last_played': 1498441011}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561199176910186', 'num_games_owned': 2229, 'num_reviews': 342, 'playtime_forever': 811, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 311, 'last_played': 1697030427}
review:
The prestigious Gamicademi â€“ a school of fading glory. To put it back in the spotlight, Blanc and friends decide to film a zombie flick on campus. Allâ€™s quiet on the set until real zombies start crawling out of the woodworks! Now theyâ€™ve got to send these zombies to detention in this hack â€˜nâ€™ slash or else be history!

Key Features
- Fight off zombie hordes in 1080p with a two-person tag team and rack up crazy combos!
- Team up with up to 3 other friends in online Multiplay mode to take on multiplayer quests, with new quests updated daily!
- More characters join the battle with their own fighting styles, including Plutia, Peashy, Uzume, and a new playable character â€“ Tamsoft!
- Dress to kill with customizable equipment, and accessories that can be put pretty much anywhere.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036102991', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1667417712}
review:
Pretty good combat system although it is very easy. The story is so short and also very silly. It has the best cosmetic customization I've seen when it comes to resizing and repositioning, everything you need is there! It is the main reason I'm recommending it because this game was not all that interesting otherwise. It was nice to see Blanc get her own game but she didn't feel all that much like the Blanc from Super Neptunia RPG which is my favorite Blanc so far, so it wasn't really all that interesting to me. 

Thankfully the game doesn't waste your time with travelling, you just skip dialogue or read/listen through it and then you get your battle. Simple progression means you don't get stuck. Only thing that was tricky about this game was the unlocking of new conversations for 100 percent completion but I couldn't be bothered to do that(would include doing all the battles again and leveling up and such) since I wasn't liking the story quite so much, but it was good enough that I got to see a conclusion to the game in a timely manner. Was a bit disappointed that it didn't go longer, but if I cared that much about it I'd unlock the extra conversations.

author: {'steamid': '76561198216851783', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1694392564}
review:
Primero que nada es un honor ser la primera reseÃ±a al espaÃ±ol hahaha
no se dejen llevar por el tiempo del juego vengo jugando este juego cuando la vita aun tenia vida 
primero que nada si vienes de jugar el NeptiniaU te vas a llevar una decepciÃ³n 
comparando con su antecesor este es un paso a tras 
- los graficos, no tanto de los personajes, si no de los escenario se les nota un bajÃ³n en el diseÃ±o, no digo que el anterior tenia mejores grÃ¡ficos pero los escenarios eran mas detallados  
-un ambiente gris y sin vida, ya se que quieren darle un toque pelÃ­culas de zombies pero los juegos de neptunia se destacan por ambientes coloridos aun en situaciones devastadoras 
-mapas grandes pero vacÃ­os, en ocaciones te vaz a topar con mapas enormes lo malo que toda la accion solo ocurre en una esquina de estos por lo que lo demÃ¡s queda inutilizable 
-la cantidad y variedad de enemigo fue reducida, el juego anterior destacaba por escenarios pequeÃ±os pero lo compensaba con la absurda cantidad de monstruos en la zonas que te daba ratos de diversiÃ³n, aquÃ­ se queda corto la cantidad es tan diminuta que la acciÃ³n pasa de un parpadeo y te da una sensaciÃ³n amarga que realmente no hiciste nada 
-nivel de dificultad, el juego anterior la dificultad estaba rota es decir la distribuciÃ³n de experiencia era absurda que los personajes podrÃ­an ser unas maquinas de matar por la exageradas subida de nivel que tenÃ­an, se nota que quisieron arreglar eso disminuyendo los punto de experiencia y aumentado el daÃ±o causado por los monstruos y en eso falla por que los personajes pueden ser igual de rotos que el juego anterior aun si no suben mucho de nivel   
-poco contenido a pesar del juego anterior que tenia variedad e quest aqui en la campaÃ±a principar ni a eso llega puede jugar los quiest principales y secundario aun asÃ­ acabar la campaÃ±a muy rapido por lo que el tiempo en terminar este juego es muy corto 
-un multijugador pobre, si la campaÃ±a te resulto corta y quieres entrar al multi por mas contenido adivina que, tambien queda corto por los mismos problemas que sufrÃ­a la campaÃ±a principal 
- un prota desechable, si querÃ­an que Blanc tuviera su propio juego como protagonista hubiesen inventado otra cosa, este juego se ve que fue hecho a prisas y sin ideas que no le hace justicia al personaje 
- falta de fanservice, si el juego anterior te gusto por el modo de romper la ropa pues esa idea la desecharon, no digo que lo debe de tener pero si tu buscabas contenido asi, pues aqui no lo vas a encontrar 

pasando los contras mencionare los pro del juego si aun te interesa adquirir este juego 
-variedad de nemigos en el multi, a pesar del corto contenido que tambiÃ©n sufre la campaÃ±a puedes toparte con enemigos nuevos y Ãºnicos e incluso de entregas anteriores 
-mas waifus por jugar, si eres fan de la franquicia este juego tiene un aumento en el repertorio de personajes que le hacia falta en la entrega en su antecesor, no te va decepcionar 
- modo de personalizaciÃ³n, si tu personaje se ve aburrido puedes personalizarlo como te gusta al conseguir accesorios que puedes usarlos a tu gusto comprÃ¡ndolos en la tienda del juego que obtienes con puntos al jugar los modos de juego 

puede que el juego tenga mas contras que pros, no es el peor pero tampoco es el mejor juego de la franquicia es otro mas de su muchas entregas solo para pasar el rato, si eres fans puede que te guste pero con un mal sabor de boca, si eres nuevo voltea otro lado que existen mejores musous que este juego

author: {'steamid': '76561198394251993', 'num_games_owned': 426, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 1135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 898, 'last_played': 1664464392}
review:
MegaTagmension es un universo alternativo que gira en torno al argumento de rodar una pelÃ­cula -y secuela- de zombies para  evitar que cierren las puertas la academia donde CPUS y humanos conviven. Durante la grabaciÃ³n oyen la "leyenda" de una dimensiÃ³n oscura que ha traÃ­do el apocalipsis a esta academia. El argumento intenta parodiar -sin Ã©xito- los malos giros de guiÃ³n y estereotipos de las pelÃ­culas de zombies de serie B y de la saga Resident Evil.

El juego se compone de dos modos de juego principales, que es el modo historia en el que se desarrolla a travÃ©s de 12 capÃ­tulos, y un modo multijugador donde se desarrolla desafÃ­os diarios o completar una serie de desafÃ­os relativos a la leyenda negra de GamingIndustri. Por suerte, este Ãºltimo modo puede completarse en solitario sin muchos problemas debido a que no hay salas activas para jugar en modo cooperativo.

El modo de juego es un Action RPG en tiempo real, en el que destaca el uso de combos con un personaje asistente. Los controles son sencillos y los combates en general no dan ningÃºn problema, dada la cantidad de experiencia recibida en torno al capÃ­tulo 6. Mi gran problema es que no es nada fÃ¡cil fijar a un enemigo cuando estÃ¡s rodeado, especialmente cuando quieres derrotar a un jefe y no preocuparte de los demÃ¡s.  Tampoco ayuda la cÃ¡mara, que tiende a bajar su altura en pleno combate, restando visiÃ³n al juego: no es problema si se usa gamepads pero llega a ser una molestia si eres un jugador que le guste usar el teclado y, por desgracia, no tiene teclado numÃ©rico que son las definidas por defecto.

Los trofeos son relativamente sencillos y consisten en acabar el modo historia y compra de objetos, subir a un personaje al nivel mÃ¡ximo, alcanzar el nivel de amistad con otro personaje (aproximadamente diez combates) o realizar un largo combo. Sin embargo hay dostrofeos que pueden ser una verdadera molestia si te gusta conseguir el 100%.  En estos dos  tienes que coleccionar todas las partes de tesoros y todas las partes de los jefes finales del modo multijugador; son completamente al azar y puede salirte a la primera o despuÃ©s de veinte combates.

En cuanto a extras, destaca la galerÃ­a donde puedes desbloquear "tomas falsas" del rodaje -no cambia nada, tan sÃ³lo se sustituyen unos personajes por otros - y las conversaciones en backstage entre los personajes. Todas ellas pueden conseguirse uniendo a dos personajes como principal y soporte en determinados capÃ­tulos. El juego te da las pistas suficientes para saber quÃ© hacer.  TambiÃ©n hay un modo trampa que desbloquea bonuses para la historia principal del juego, consistente en matar de un sÃ³lo golpe, vida y especial inifinto pero son completamente inÃºtiles debido a que no hay motivos para usarlo si ya has completado el modo historia.

Para terminar, deberÃ­a decir que me ha gustado el juego y es bastante recomendable para jugadores casuales. Por desgracia este spin-off ha perdido el sentido del humor que caracteriza la saga principal y puede sacarte una pequeÃ±a sonrisa si eres capaz de detectar algÃºn homenaje en el diÃ¡logo.  Si eres un jugador exigente que espera un hack&slash difÃ­cil al estilo Dark Souls o cualquier RPG inspirado en Roguelikes, este no es tu tipo de juego que pudieras dedicarle tiempo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276607473', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1671935775}
review: Parece una continuaciÃ³n de Neptunia U Action Unleashed asÃ­ que estÃ¡ lleno de acciÃ³n. Lo empecÃ© en PSVita pero al ser una pantalla muy pequeÃ±a, se me complicaba seguirle el ritmo por lo que ahora puedo disfrutarlo de una mejor manera.

author: {'steamid': '76561197988000877', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 240, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1663901471}
review:
Neptune Vs Zombies is a perfectly okay game. They make alot of improvements to Action Unleashed, but have an equal number of missteps that hurt the experience. In the end, I had fun and Iâ€™m giving this a reluctant thumbs up for people that both: â€œLike neptuniaâ€ and â€œEnjoy fast, dumb actionâ€

The core gameplay, like AU, involves spawning into a map with hundreds of enemies and mashing them as hard as you mash the X button. Thereâ€™s loads of special moves and button combinations, but none of them actually matter because the gameplay is as dumb as a certain lovable CPU. But Iâ€™ve put quite a few hours into both games because it DOES work.

The overall pacing is exponentially better than Action Unleashed. The story is told in a sequential set of levels and your characters grow near enough to the mission difficulties.  You earn a decent chunk of money to unlock weapons and items, Lily Ranks grow 1 per mission instead of 1 per 3, and there is story* EVERY mission. When I sit down to play, I enjoy the experience and there was never any doubt Iâ€™d finish this game.

*Story might be too strong a word. Silly pointless cutscenes would be more accurate.*

But the pacing on the missions themselves is downright awful. Iâ€™ll often run 3-5 minute cutscenes only to start a mission that ends in under a minute.  I found myself longing for Action Unleashâ€™s defeat 300 enemy missions and hidden objectives. 

The moment-to-moment play is another area where it doesnâ€™t quite excel. The increased speed of combat is nice and exciting, thereâ€™s loads of button combinations and the UI offers no hints to what they are. Itâ€™s equal parts overwhelming, and a constant reminder that the gameplay isnâ€™t deep enough to need them.  

Itâ€™s worth mentioning that I had quite a bit of fun with the multiplayer levels even as a solo player and it almost feels like you were expected to switch between single player and MP for a smooth leveling curve through the story. I found it to be a good break from the pacing in the main game and definitely want to recommend this mode.

This game is not a must-play, it is not a deep meaningful RPG, and itâ€™s neither a masterpiece of narrative nor gameplay. But it works well enough that Iâ€™d say give it a chance at a deep discount if this seems like your thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198983109775', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 1592, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1592, 'last_played': 1659667287}
review: This was a good game to try for a nice introduction into a hack and slash style game. I was kinda disappointed that it was so short though. Only takes about 5 hours to get through all of the story and it probably will be faster for someone who can clear all the scenes on the first try. At least the co-op feature gives you a bit more to do. But beware, the co-op portion is a bit buggy if you try to play with a friend.

author: {'steamid': '76561199088718007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 473, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1700577507}

author: {'steamid': '76561198415303823', 'num_games_owned': 122, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 162, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1663633335}
review:
A Technical but lovable mess. As per usual with IF's side games, they are not ported well.
It takes ages to change the game's resolution, it takes a bit to load to get through the splash screens.
Skills sometimes don't unleash when the buttons are pressed. Not as bad as Hyperdevotion Noire but I'd still suggest to get a PS Vita copy instead.

review: Blanc is cute and a game all about her is quite entertaining. The story is funny and the characters are true to the franchise. Combat takes some getting used to but is neat once you level up and learn the controls (it comes with a PDF manual, use it). Many outfits, pantsu shots and things to make your heroines cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198208805037', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 754, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1688981104}
review:
This one is in the same vein as Nep U but it did a better job on the story IMO.

It's Neptunia, if you like the series you won't be too disappointed with this one.

I did like how the main charcter role was shared by Blanc and Neptune though. I just think it's a bad idea to distance Nep from her role as main character too much and this one didn't make that mistake so good on the devs for learning.

Neptune is the protag of protags after all!

author: {'steamid': '76561199066246445', 'num_games_owned': 1541, 'num_reviews': 263, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 750, 'last_played': 1653270485}
review:
no lo recomiendo a pesar de que amo a neptune :c
por los siguientes motivos: los enemigos estan en un spot fijo (o sea todos amontonados en una zona pequeÃ±a a pesar de tener un mapa en el cual podrian meter 5000 enemigos pero solo te toca matar oleadas de a 10 o 20) por lo que cada partida dura nada practicamente...
pareciese que hubieran arruinado todo lo bueno que tenia el action unleashed, este juego tiene menu tras menu y tarda mas en cargar que lo que dura la partida...
es una lastima pero por las pantallas de cargas y su lento progreso lo deje de juegar antes de desbloquear a plutia y peashy (motivo por el cual me compre este juego pero quede muy decepcionada) :Â´C

author: {'steamid': '76561198421947470', 'num_games_owned': 18, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 387, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 363, 'last_played': 1653300359}

author: {'steamid': '76561198045398392', 'num_games_owned': 1835, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1651155345}
review:
[h1] 5 / 10 [/h1]

Clunky & Unresponsive, which is huge minus for this genre of video game. Story is fine, nothing special.

Clunkyness is mostly due to how targeting and camera works, for some reason camera lock drops all the time.
Unresponsive is because sometimes you can't use your EXE drive skills etc. (super moves).
Both seem to vary by characters you play as, clunkyness can be counteracted by playing characters with a lot of AOE, etc.

Game is not recommend to all but die hard neptunia fans, or with huge sale if you really like what you see.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004483814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1614, 'last_played': 1642845738}
review:
As with all Idea Factory games it's one step forward one step back; shame when it could just be a better Action U. 
The Pros:
Much better story than Action U
Peashy
Plutia
Uzume
Tamsoft
Lots of costumes
Cons:
Combat is as stiff as a bored
All characters feel much worse than their Action U versions
Special moves are On a cool down instead of Meter based, so less spamming skills
Daily quests lock some enemies to specific days of the week (needed for achievos)
Grinding bosses for treasure drops suck balls
Neutral:
Assist characters (there's only like 8 and they hardly do anything, half are dogoos)
Online(Should be the main draw of playing this over action U but good like ever finding a game)

author: {'steamid': '76561198165137902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 436, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1668150239}
review:
its neptunia but with senran kagura mechanics

basically to save the school, blanc and others come up with writing a movie
blanc's the mc but it's not rly too interesting

gameplay and char interactions r cool, but the story is eh
its more a filler game and it sadly feels as such
its fun to play and has awesome music, but def not for everyone

**EDIT** btw online's pretty much dead, so make sure u have friends that also own this if u wanna play matches

[i]Edit as of 11/3/2021[/i]
after playing the crossover between the two devs (NepxSenKag: Ninja Wars) it's [i]really[/i] difficult to come back to this, due to a more refined and cooler combat system.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132138200', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 1196, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1628483239}
review:
Este juego representa todo el porque de que la comunidad de Neptunia odie los spin-offs.

- Personajes desaprovechados(como siempre).
- Gameplay horriblemente simple(aÃºn para los estÃ¡ndares de la serie).
- Historia aburridisima. Meten a los personajes a un instituto y no hacen nada interesante con ellos, hasta duele y todo la falta de inspiraciÃ³n a la hora de crear buenas y graciosas interacciones.
- Chistes pobres, y comedia(algo que caracteriza mucho a los juegos de Neptunia) prÃ¡cticamente inexistente.
- ReutilizaciÃ³n de recursos abusiva. El juego aporta poco y nada comparado con U Action Unleashed ademas de encima quitar cosas que si eran bien recibidas, como la pose de victoria a la hora de acabar las misiones. Que decisiÃ³n mas extraÃ±a.

Lo bueno que le podrÃ­a sacar a este juego es que corre bastante bien. Pero tarda mucho en iniciar, cosa que se me hace muy rara. De 3 a 5 minutos para iniciar el pto juego. Al menos demuestra que utilizaron la base para crear 4 Goddesses Online, el cual si es un buen juego que trata de aportar algo mas a la saga, ademas de ser muy gracioso.

Es un juego aburrido carente de inspiraciÃ³n y no aporta nada a la franquicia. 

NEPTUNIA AT ITS LOWEST.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030784015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11208, 'playtime_forever': 471, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 471, 'last_played': 1628073676}
review:
MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies (Neptunia) is a pretty ridiculous name for a game.  It's also a console ported third person brawler from Japan featuring a heavy Visual Novel veneer on lightweight arcade combo wave survival brawling, and a bunch of anime looking girls (it's from Japan so that's to be expected).   Gameplay consists of fighting through waves of enemies using various arcade fighting combos and specials. 

This is a truly atrocious console port.  Console peasant childrens toy controller prompts.  Migraine inducingly bad camera controls (just the way peasants like it!).  Resolution that doesn't go past 1080p despite the 2016 release date.   This is a firm and fine example of consoles making gaming worse for everyone, and should be avoided at all costs.

review:
Bom, nÃ£o sou um grande fÃ£ de jogos de RPG. Se tratando da sÃ©rie de jogos da Neptunia acabo ignorando a maioria de seus tÃ­tulos em decorrer disto. Quero dizer, prefiro jogos de aÃ§Ã£o em tempo real.
Conheci este game em Ã©poca de promoÃ§Ã£o, no qual se oferecia alguns pacotes de jogos da Neptunia e um deles consistia nos jogos de aÃ§Ã£o (apenas 3, sendo este, mais o Cyberdimension Neptunia e o Hyperdimension Neptunia U). No caso, este Ã© o primeiro que zerei 100%.

Falando da minha experiÃªncia, foi simplesmente boa (nada fantÃ¡stico, mas me rendeu algumas horas de diversÃ£o, 28 horas pra ser mais exato rs). No caso, o game conta com um modo histÃ³ria bem curto (vocÃª zera em algumas horas, acho que passei ela inteira em cerca de 5 horas). Claro, no caso, nÃ£o acompanhei os diÃ¡logos (se o fizesse acho que estenderia de meia hora e 1 hora a mais).

Se fosse sÃ³ isso que o game tivesse a oferecer, provavelmente eu nÃ£o o indicaria. Contudo, ele conta com o modo "Multi" que Ã© feito para jogar online, mas infelizmente Ã© raro encontrar alguÃ©m pra jogar. Felizmente dÃ¡ pra jogar neste modo sozinho e Ã© por meio deste que vocÃª realmente vai ter os maiores desafios do game, incluso chefes que nÃ£o existem no modo histÃ³ria. Em decorrÃªncia disto, serÃ¡ necessÃ¡rio, para os desafios mais avanÃ§ados, que se eleve o level de alguma personagem de preferÃªncia (no caso, acabei usando mais a Tamsoft e a Iris Heart, mas, vai da preferÃªncia do jogador). Vale lembrar que elas vÃ£o sendo liberadas no modo histÃ³ria (a Tamsoft que citei Ã© disponÃ­vel desde o inÃ­cio, se nÃ£o me falha a memÃ³ria, mas a Plutia, que quando transformada vira a Iris Heart, Ã© liberada no meio de seu progresso no modo histÃ³ria). Elevar nÃ­veis de ataque e defesa sÃ£o essenciais para completar o modo Multi, especialmente se for sozinho (foi o que fiz, no caso rs). 

A gameplay Ã© agradÃ¡vel, embora nÃ£o tenha um modo tutorial para facilitar o aprendizado (tem apenas uns prints disponÃ­veis). Contudo, Ã© simples de aprender, nÃ£o tem um gameplay complexo.

Enfim, Ã© mais ou menos isso. Eu recomendo o game, especialmente em Ã©poca de promoÃ§Ã£o (atualmente sai quase de graÃ§a em Ã©poca de promoÃ§Ã£o rs). Tem um DLC tambÃ©m que basicamente disponibiliza alguns, digamos, brindes (Wallpapers, Artbook), mas nÃ£o Ã© essencial para a experiÃªncia do game em si.

author: {'steamid': '76561198982483404', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1148, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 573, 'last_played': 1703556225}
review:
Me gustan los Hack n Slash y Ã©ste juego no es Metal Gear Rising, me gustan las mecÃ¡nicas de RPG y Ã©ste juego no Ã©sta ni de cerca tan bien desarrollado como en otros juegos, me gustan los juegos donde la exploraciÃ³n de los calabozos recompensan al jugador y en Ã©ste juego los calabozos estÃ¡n tan mal diseÃ±ados que no hay ningÃºn incentivo para ello.

Pero lo que mÃ¡s me gustan y disfruto son los personajes. Sus diseÃ±os llamativos y sus actitudes tan despreocupadas me hacen olvidar todos los puntos anteriores.
La historia de estos juegos siempre Ã©sta llena de estupideces, chistes de doble sentido, juegos de palabras, situaciones absurdas y una infinidad de referencias a otros videojuegos y la cultura pop en general. Todo sumado a un poquito de fan service que sinceramente no le cae nada mal, je.

En definitiva, todos los que estamos aquÃ­ sabemos que esperar de un juego como Ã©ste. Y eso estÃ¡ bien. El juego conoce sus limitaciones y no se toma en serio en ningÃºn momento la posibilidad de superarse.

Si deseas apagar tus neuronas un rato, Ã©ste juego cumple bien Ã©sta tarea. RECOMENDADO.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127807774', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1827, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1827, 'last_played': 1598634979}
review:
Another Neptunia action game that 100% does not deserve its Very Positive rating. It doesn't even deserve anything higher than a Mixed rating.

This game is what you get when you don't expect anything better from the masterminds of not giving a rat's bum about making actually good games.

MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies (which I will now shorten to ZombieNep because any game that tries to have "omg quirkyyyyy!!! long name!!! XDD" is just annoying at this point) is a lot like the previous Neptunia action game - completely not worth your time and money, ahem, I mean, it's a Warriors game with none of the fun of playing one.

I shall now copy and paste some parts of the review I made for Action Unleashed, to reflect how the developers copied and pasted some parts of Action Unleashed to make this game.



This game is a perfect description of me: mostly soulless, boring, and the things it does, others do way better for the same price. This is a game that got Very Positive solely because of the franchise it is so sloppily stapled to. If any other developer were to make something of this calibre, it would get laughed out the door. A tried and true example of "Why spend money to make a good game, when our horny fans will buy it anyway?"

The enemies lack any sort of intelligence, with their sole purpose seemingly to just merge their body with yours in the vain hopes of dealing damage. You'd have to play like a complete idiot to even give them a fighting chance. I get that this is a Warriors type game, but even other Warriors games don't have infantry that are this incompetent at doing their one, sole job. And for fuchs sake, sometimes the enemies can't even hit you while you're standing right next to them.

Combat is incredibly boring and repetitive - even more so than Dynasty Warriors 9 despite only being a mere fraction of the length. It's your standard Warriors affair with large, sweeping normal and heavy attacks, special attacks for quick area clearing, and EXE Drives for killing anyone in the same postal code. Yet, for some reason, despite having all the basic fundamentals of a Warriors game, it's nowhere near as fun as one should be. The balancing between the playable characters is completely non-existent, and you can steamroll the entire game in your sleep - the state in which the game most certainly would bore you into. 

Stages never last longer than three minutes. And to all those that would inevitably say "It's a portable console game, the levels aren't supposed to be long". Two words: Monster Hunter. Hell, Metal Gear Solid Peace Walker was on the PSP, so any arguments that portable console games are supposed to have short levels are invalid.

You can tell they really just wanted to phone it in - an astounding lack of passion and effort that is honestly almost on par with the annual EA sports games.

I won't even talk about the story because it's forgettable. I dunno, something happens at a school or something and it involves zombies, I guess, and everything that happens in between are a blurry haze. At the very least, most of the game is voice acted in English for all you dub fans, and the writing for the banter between characters is alright. But that's it, really, the only good things about this game don't even pertain to what's arguably the most important aspect of an action-oriented video game - the gameplay.



Now for the things that are different.

At the very least they made new maps... that they don't even use in their entirety, and are entirely flat, and uninteresting. Christ almighty, it's like for every step forward they take, they run back eight hundred miles.

You can block... In a game where most characters have evade dashes that allow them to span the entire Great Wall of China, so it's completely pointless... Unless you're abusing its ability to cancel the recovery animation of evade dashes, meaning the only reasonable purpose of the block is so you can dodge faster. So much for guarding.

There's a character progression system. It's basic, but it's there.

There's online multiplayer... with some of the worst idiot netcode I've seen in my life. Playing CS 1.6 with a 56k modem is a far smoother experience than ZombieNep's pitiful excuse for online multiplayer. Crashes can happen for any reason. Switch character in the lobby? Crash. Fight a boss in an empty arena with your best mate? Crash. Just launching the damn multiplayer? Crash. I'm all but certain that if your PC detects you coughing too loudly in multiplayer it would probably be grounds to cause the game to crash.



The optimisation is of questionable quality. The game seems to suffer from slowdown at time, especially during sections of heavy combat. It's not a frequent occurrence, but it happens enough for me to notice. My rig isn't the best, but you'd think a GTX 1050,  16 GB of RAM, and an i7 would be able to run a Vita port.


Look, if you wanted a good musou or Warriors game... Senran Kagura and the actual Warriors games exist. There's no need to waste your time and money on this one like I have. Don't even buy this game on sale. Don't reward mediocrity.

author: {'steamid': '76561198257887491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 356, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 356, 'last_played': 1519334523}
review:
Just like all the other games of this series it has funny dialogue and cute characters with some slightly perverted scenes which they have completely built a following around without actually creating anything else worth calling a good game.

areas reused many many times, palette swaps on everything no semblance of a real story but unfortunately they have a large following of fans that will buy just based on perverted scenes which just perpetuates this kind of bland sub-par crap thats ultimately just hurting the entire gaming industry by lowering the standards of what is passable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198078055267', 'num_games_owned': 2864, 'num_reviews': 280, 'playtime_forever': 135, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 135, 'last_played': 1618323259}
review:
First of all I gotta mention that I really didn't like Action Unleashed, a game that came previously that is very similar to this one. So I did not expect that I would like this one either. Combat is mediocre and bland and is either way too easy or way too hard when they introduce enemies that you have to grind levels to beat them. Story is just filler and also the game is very short. The map is empty and I really don't like the bullet sponge enemies. The game just tells you all the controls at the beginning and doesn't explain any of them properly.

In terms of bugs and glitches, any videos that plays is black and you can't see anything. I've heard there is a way to fix it but it's annoying that you have to be the one to fix it, not to mention that the fix involves tampering with the registry editor.

Overall I really don't like these neptunia hack and slash games. Wish they'd go back to making JRPGs...

author: {'steamid': '76561198115928944', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 361, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 361, 'last_played': 1618167570}

author: {'steamid': '76561198262452338', 'num_games_owned': 1861, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 448, 'last_played': 1618074951}
review:
[b]MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies[/b] is yet another spin-off in the Neptunia series and a kind of sequel to [url=store.steampowered.com/app/387340]Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed[/url]. It features characters from all 4 mainline games (up to VII), so it's recommended you play all those first, else you'll be left wondering who are all these characters and why are they hanging out together.

The gameplay is the same kind of [url=store.steampowered.com/app/411830]Senran Kagura[/url] lite just like Action Unleashed. But the mechanics have been expanded a bit, there are now lock on and block/parry buttons. Just like before you take two characters on a mission, switch between them whenever, go HDD if you feel like it, and mash buttons a lot. The gameplay is very easy and very shallow, even compared to Senran Kagura. The enemies are very slow moving and telegraph their attacks way in advance, so the only difficulty is not falling asleep while you're hacking away at the more spongy ones.

The game features the whole cast from Action Unleashed (that is, 4 CPU's, 4 candidates + Dengekiko & Famitsu), as well as some newcomers, namely Plutia, Peashy, Uzume and Tamsoft (the developer's original character, also appears as an NPC in [url=store.steampowered.com/app/632350]Cyberdimension Neptunia: 4 Goddesses Online[/url]). Iffy and Compa sadly aren't playable.

While Action Unleashed was almost entirely an asset flip of Re;Birth games in a Senran Kagura engine, MegaTagmension is a higher effort production and features many new assets thanks to its school/zombie theme. The girls get cute school uniforms, there are new enemies, levels and backgrounds. Of course, a decent amount of assets are still recycled because hey it's a Neptunia game and it has to be eco-friendly. But overall, the graphics are nicer than in Action Unleashed, and the Live2D scenes are 1080p this time around instead of 720p.

The clothes tearing mechanic (which was prominent in Action Unleashed and Senran Kagura games) is now gone. Seems like it was a last minute change probably because of censorship concerns. You can even equip torn versions of default outfits, but the gradual tearing of clothes (along with the very sexy cutscenes that accompanied it) is not in the game anymore.

Overall, the story and gameplay won't blow your mind, but it's a decent time waster if you like the Neptunia series and its characters. Also, keep in mind that the game has a couple of minor issues when running on Windows 10 and but they're [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2251930280]easy to fix[/url].

review: pretty good game; its a different experience from the main stream games but still good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198054481368', 'num_games_owned': 194, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 617, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 617, 'last_played': 1515959378}
review:
If you are looking for a challenge or a decent story, then this game is not for you. Beat the game in less than 6 hours with little effort, the story is not memorable at all. At the most the story is meh. I get that the story in most games tend to be more on the comedy side, however this story was not funny (in my opinion). I feel the same way when it comes to Neptunia U action unleashed, however the game play (in my opinion) is better since its less confusing and there is some sort of challenge IF you are not paying attention.

I love the Neptunia series, however this is easily one of the bad games in the series (again in my opinion).

author: {'steamid': '76561198075089585', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 472, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 472, 'last_played': 1614022487}
review:
I wanna say this right away, the game is not bad, but it is not good either.
Combat is similar to Neptunia U, if you know, you know. It didnt change too much, however new characters have been added, each character has more abilities, so thats nice. The "story" is very cringy, and thats coming from a neptunia enthusiast, it wasnt terrible, in fact there were hilarious dialogue sections but all in all this game ends  up on the worse end of the neptunia games. My major qualm with this game is the way they designed the gameplay loop, you get a linear storyline with a sequence of dungeons and set enemies and requirements, the only way to grind is to re-run previous missions, there is no side content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198839521753', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1689567591}
review:
Fun Neptunia spin-off. This game is funny. It is more of a funny and light-hearted visual novel game with a bit of easy hack and slash.
The game has no difficulty settings.
It took me around 7 hours to beat it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198256120219', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1078, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 906, 'last_played': 1642836275}
review: It is a fun game. But I do advice that you play with a controller rather than a keyboard. Controls are a little weird and take a bit of time getting used to. All of the characters are cute too, my favourites being Nepgear and Noire. However, you should stay away from this game if you don't like anime-levels of weird sexual content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137376448', 'num_games_owned': 6881, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 1922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1922, 'last_played': 1610597940}
review:
This is just a terrible game that got "Very Positive" ratings because fans will feel like they have to say they love any piece of... carp IF throws at them. I really like Nep games, and I managed to enjoy MegaTagmension because of that, but I'm not fanatic and I can see how it's just an atrocious garbage of a game.

This time, the star is Blanc, who decides to write and direct a zombie movie in their school so it doesn't close, and real zombies appear, which is a blessing so they can save production money. The playstyle is a hack and slash, a musou, with light RPG elements, very similar to Action Unleashed.

PROS:
- The characters you know and love
- It features both a Story mode and a "Multi" mode, in which you can play online with friends. (in theory? I never saw anyone online). You can solo Multi lol, but no local co-op for you.

NEUTRAL:
- Like all of Nep games, at least 80% of assets are recycled from other Nep games. Characters, outfits, enemies, items... I mean, they're good, but when you're at your 5th or 6th game, it starts to feel like a rip off. And it is that.
- Runs smoothly and glitch-free today, but I've read there were bugs before.

CONS:
- Combat "system" is full of features you'll never need to use, as you'll just need to dash and mash the simple attack button. Use skills when they charge. Dodge and defend only if you want to end the battle faster. And forget about items, I never ever used them. I didn't even ever felt the need to transform into HDD.
- Extremely unbalanced. You get a fuse (craft) system that requires high-end materials for stuff you can acquire in much easier ways. I only crafted once, for the achievement. Most of the items I still wasn't able to craft because of the lack of materials, even after 100%ing the game with all achievements, and I had tons of those items to be crafted anyways. Basically, the products are very common, while their ingredients can be extremely rare. How does that make sense?
- Weapons. Each girls gets 4. While the latest weapons have stronger raw power, they don't have as many "slots" for "attachments" which improve it, so they don't feel like an improvement (unless you're not using those attachments), and I still feel that need for an ultimate weapon.
- Insanely long loading screens, which probably amounts to about 5 hours of my total gameplay. It's really annoying when you spend more time loading into and out of the stage than in the actual stage (not always, but can happen when you're farming easier stages. To make things worse, Multi adds a 10-sec "ending session" timer to your wait.
- Awful story. Nep games don't have good stories (they don't, fans), but it's usually nice to see they interact and act silly, and generate some sort of goofy comedy. I'm not sure if it's because Blanc was in command, but the story was a really tedious experience that can cure severe cases of insomnia. Every chapter is basically the same things, girls acting in a scene of the movie Blanc is shooting. It can be fun 2, 3 times, but when I was halfway through the Story mode, I couldn't take it anymore and started skipping dialogues, for the first time in a Nep game, and for the first time in a looooong time for all games.
- Some maps are complex, but those are always very empty. You can walk around (painfully slowly) and explore, but there's nothing to gain, not even enemies to fight.
- Lacks decent explanations about most stuff. I'll split this into multiple topics:
>> You don't have a proper inventory. If you want to know how many of an item you have (unless it's a consumable), you have to try to sell that item,
>> No bestiary where you can keep track of enemies weaknesses and strengths, or which have you defeated yet.
>> It took me many stages to realize how to equip consumables, but even then I never got to use an item.
>> Hard to access information on lily rank bonuses, but again those matter little
>> No information on skills, except for when you actually try them out
>> It's absurd that you have to leave Story mode in order to access the Gallery, especially when the Gallery provides hints (sometimes inaccurate) on how to unlock extra scenes in Story mode. So there, more loading screens if you want to check the Gallery (don't, just use a guide)
>> Half-baked and poorly explained weakness/strength system, and very unbalanced in the sense that some attack types are the weakness of many bosses, while others don't show at all for the major bosses.

VERDICT:
There are probably still many bad things to talk about this game. I enjoyed it because, you know, I like the Nepverse, but it's  objective a terrible game. If you honestly want to know, then this game is probably not for you. If you're reading just to talk trash because you're die-hard fan, then nothing I say will matter anyway...

author: {'steamid': '76561198077724160', 'num_games_owned': 211, 'num_reviews': 281, 'playtime_forever': 1170, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1170, 'last_played': 1597087797}
review:
Definitely has the lack of polish of a spin-off. The story is interesting, but kind of bland. The battles are fairly straight forward as long as you stay on the move. The controls feel a little off. I don't know how to describe it, but i was constantly forgetting what button did what. It was fun to see the CPUs and candidates in a school setting.
I have had [spoiler]Nepgear[/spoiler]x[spoiler]Uni[/spoiler] as head cannon for so long, that I almost missed the actual ship in the game. Wish it was canon. lol
The multiplayer is dead, but I kind of expected that. I've only met like three other players ever, and one of them disconnected instantly because he forgot to set a password that wasn't "1234".

author: {'steamid': '76561198074613709', 'num_games_owned': 824, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 947, 'last_played': 1608248737}
review:
MegaTagmension is another Action Game from Neptunia Series.
Currently, i've only played this one so my judgement will not be based on Neptunia U or any other action game from the series.

Based on that I can say that the game is decent for a Neptunia Game.
You have your classic jokes in the main story and some good references from other games and all. In term of design it's Neptunia so it's a classic.
The main problem for me at the moment is that the game feel kind of sluggish until you get used to it and even after that there's still a weird feeling to it.
There is a good cast of character from the Neptunia games and it's clearly a plus for those who want specific character (do inform yourself to know which ones are here)

I've totaly completed the game from Story to multiplayer missions and it's totaly doable as a solo player. Nothing really hard once you've found the character you enjoy to play !

As for the Multiplayer i'ven't tried it with any friend so i can't really judge this part, i'm pretty sure it's ok from previous IF experiences (nothing great and it's playable).

Finally, for the price tag, I would recommend to pick it during a sale or in a Neptunia Bundle.

TL;DR : Okay Neptunia Action game with a decent story for a Neptunia. Wait for a sale or a Bundle !

review: I don't know how this game somehow manages to be worse than Action Unleashed despite literally using the same engine. Questionable hitboxes, attacks with no wind up, attacks that aren't even attacks, and i-frames that just kinda decide to not be there at times can't be saved by waifus and pandering. ... author: {'steamid': '76561198095082555', 'num_games_owned': 543, 'num_reviews': 363, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1597190133}
review:
A great Nep spinoff that doesn't take itself too seriously. The premise is hilarious. Zombies take over a local school that the CPUs are secretly attending and they decide to film a zombie movie while they fight them.

The quality of the experience is quite high for a Nep spinoff, the dialogue and presentation is great and feels on par with even the mainline games.

The only issue I have is that the missions are a little too short.

But most importantly, IT HAS UZUME!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045765418', 'num_games_owned': 2112, 'num_reviews': 776, 'playtime_forever': 2706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2311, 'last_played': 1595871560}
review:
Game is based on the series of Light Novels, where the CPUs are high school students and not Goddesses, called Chou Jigen Game Neptune: High School, although in this game they still are Goddesses.

Story set in another alternate universe, the girls are CPUs going to high school in order to learn more about humans. While at this point in time, the school is being threatened with closing as birth rates have declined. They try making a zombie movie when they accidentally summon zombies to their world.

Gameplay is simple. You move freely around the world and attack enemies. When buttons are pressed with the correct timing you can easily connect combos, launch enemies into the air and perform air combos. Can also utilize up to two different characters during battle and switch out characters at will.

Come for story, stay for cute characters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124964574', 'num_games_owned': 1805, 'num_reviews': 378, 'playtime_forever': 404, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1593086670}
review:
I enjoy this series, but this game is terrible. Hyperdimension U: Action Unleashed was way better.
I didn't enjoy the writing and humor at all in this one, which is the main reason anyone plays these games.
The gameplay is awful and I hit a wall on the first boss in 3-4 despite being over-levelled.
The multiplayer mode can actually be played solo if you create your own room. Unfortunately, there are daily missions that are only playable on certain days of the week. Highly disrespectful of players' time.
TLDR: Bad writing and overpowered bosses. Some multiplayer missions are exclusive to a day of the week.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014550677', 'num_games_owned': 43, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 182, 'last_played': 1590311584}
review: As far as the Neptunia series of games go, MegaTagmension is a welcomed entry with slight twists to the combat that Action Unleashed presented. This entry feels less "button masher" based and somewhat relies on your ability to understand the combos, which you upgrade this time around. While most normal enemies can be taken down easily, the bosses tend to be much more difficult using that approach. This helps the game to stand out more in challenge and overall ability to keep players interested. Not to mention the story, while being mostly what you would expect from a Neptunia spin-off game, has it's fair share of moments which make it worth a shot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198964879450', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1784, 'last_played': 1593364311}
review:
[h1]Fun Story, Mediocre Gameplay[/h1]
At first, I thought this game was okay. The story is overtly goofy and vaguely feels like something the Neptune Crew would be involved in. A number of cutscenes change depending on who you bring into battle, but only the most dedicated will see all of them.
The gameplay is what hurts BNVZ. Attacks often outright sail right past their target. There are only a few bland enemy types and bosses, and little strategy is involved, even with bosses: just hit the enemies until the EXE-Drive charges, then let them have it. Unfortunately, EXE attacks have a very limited range, and enemies will often move just out of range, rendering your efforts moot.
It's essentially an inferior clone of Senran Kagura, which is a shame considering they share the same developer. Only play this if you're a series fan who can't get enough of Nepnep and friends; otherwise, you have better options.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025834191', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 228, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 86, 'last_played': 1611384215}
review:
Valve's Robot Dewey said for the Spring Cleaning 'I KNOW WHAT U WANNA PLAY BRO!!!! Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies (Neptunia).... u filthy weeb u'

....I mean they weren't wrong.... 

No but seriously this game is actually pretty bad, I ACTUALLY tried to play it. Unlike the other instalments which actually had good classic JRPG combat, this game has been poorly developed (possibly due to new developers on hand Tamsoft?, where its unoptimized and confusing, not to mentioned the various crashes/bugs).....I've actually spent 80% of my game-time troubleshooting various problems and doing the developers job for them....so where does that leave us....with story? there is no story, or rather I wish there was no story because whatever they slapped together is Sweaty Fedora Wearer Fanfiction.

In conclusion its a meme-tier game at best, but broken in terms of technical aspects, so unless you own multiple fedora's and have   a beard that shields your neck...pass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075414592', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 244, 'last_played': 1672636948}

author: {'steamid': '76561198093460957', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 113, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 688, 'last_played': 1581141584}
review:
A really good port of a vita game. Essentially a lighthearted story about Blanc and co saving a school from shutting down. The story can be whimsical but it is fun seeing them get up to their old antics.
The game play is a bit like Senran Kagura but quicker. Great don't miss out on it if you are a fan of the main games. I would recommend this over Super Neptunia RPG any day of the year. Ps the Deluxe Pack has a great theme with sounds and everything I recommend that too.
https://store.steampowered.com/curator/31309147-South-Coast-NSW/

author: {'steamid': '76561198007666574', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1577941167}
{'steamid': '76561198082881386', 'num_games_owned': 1591, 'num_reviews': 307, 'playtime_forever': 1233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1233, 'last_played': 1577743114}
review:
If you are allergic to adorableness - this game will kill you.
Beeing cute is only selling point of this game so cute-factor is overwhelming here. 

Beside that - it's barebone arena hack 'n' slash.
If you play with the same characters from the beginning - you will finish it in 5-7 hours. If you like to change characters you will encounter some fights that are too hard for you... because all levels are level based - if you want to play with a lot of characters (and you have to do it to unlock hidden scenes) you will spend some time on replaying the same levels.
You can choose from various clothes... but you have to find them first (5 parts each set) and it's random.
There is a lot of hidden stuff there - but it all requires high ammount of grinding to unlock.

Also don't even think about playing this without a controller.

Review:
I am not really a huge fan of the neptune series, not in a way that I dislike it, but more to not being too familiar with who's who and what this series is about and whatnot. I've only played Nep U which was repetitive and the Re;Birth that was a turn based rpg in which i didn't play it much because I'm not a fan of turn based anyways.

The gameplay is good, there are combos and consumables, exe drive, transformation and all the good stuff. My only complaint is that using a (PS4) controller, I had to swap my dash(circle) with R2(which had nothing mapped). Most JRPGs I've played had to press R1 or R2 to dash or evade. I do like the progression system in which you level up, spend skill points and setup your gears before the battle. It's like a simpler Nier;Automata.

Storyline is okay, it's cheesy and fills in your time as well as progress your characters. You'll probably need to play this to get the few treasures you want.

The Multiplayer is great, only if you have friends because I almost can't find a stranger's lobby and nobody joins my lobby anyways. You get access to unique missions and enemies that are not in the storyline. The progression and reward here is good too. I just wished I could transform from normal form because I'm used to it when I'm playing the campaign. And also wish that people would join the lonely me.

Overall, god I love plutia and iris heart.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046234510', 'num_games_owned': 2489, 'num_reviews': 400, 'playtime_forever': 871, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 787, 'last_played': 1593843085}
review:
I really do like this game, but it's short. Most levels will end in a minute or two. VERY short tasks. 

It's not much of an improvement to Action Unleashed U. I would recommend that game more over this. 

That being said, I still think this game is still a recommend for me. For it's price, it's really fun. Plenty of characters, specifically I think 13, and then their transformed/HDD forms.

And unlike action unleashed, this game has online co-op, so if you and a friend have the game, it's a fun experience together. For a few people, that might just be the deciding factor to chose this over Action Unleashed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127145146', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1567537537}
review:
As an avid fan of Neptunia and IFI, it is with a heavy heart that i give this game a negative review. The combat is annoying and tedious, most characters are super slow (Which beats the whole purpose of a hack n slash game) skills are practically ineffective, quests don't give enough XP to efficiently level up (By the time I finished the game I was level 27, with the max being 99, and the final boss being recommended for levels 40+), Customization is pretty bland, and there's no CG gallery, which is quite surprising and disappointing, seeing as you need special criteria to unlock and view certain cutscenes. As for the plot, it's so bare bones you'd be forgiven if you even remember there's a story by the end of the game.

The pros are that if you like Neptunia, the characters are as charming as always, so at least there's that.

2/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198025102926', 'num_games_owned': 1729, 'num_reviews': 152, 'playtime_forever': 2150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1864, 'last_played': 1599633262}
review:
OK, this is a Neptunia spinoff. As such, it features the Neptunia characters in a different game and a different environment. This clearly compares to Action Unleashed, and I'd say it does better. It's not particularly long if you just go through the story and only level one character.

Now, it's on the easy side, as always. I've only really played Neptune, and found it easy to keep her overlevelled. I don't even remember whether I took damage :-) Afterwards, while I was heading for level 99, there was never anything that could hurt her, and there's only one boss that can hurt a level 99 Purple Heart. But that's just achievement grinding, of course. I still have to kill him a few times for his rare drop.

It has some kind of multiplayer, but I don't know much about it. You can't do the story in MP, as usual. "Multiplay" is important for achievements, but worry not: all of it can be soloed no problem.

Do make sure you have a guide handy. The game doesn't tell you where to get things like treasure drops, and it does NOT tell you how to unlock the extra "backstage" scenes. Which, btw., have no english voice acting -- although it's the first Neptunia game that I've played that just plays Japanese in this case (which is better than keeping it silent).

There's another bunch of extra scenes, "alternate cuts" (the story is about making a movie...), but these are pretty bad and really just good for the achievement: it's exactly the same scene, just with two "actors" replaced.

review:

Neptunia en version Hack'n slash/beat them up . Gameplay malheureusement pas trÃ¨s riche, peu d'Ã©quipements .... ce qui sauve le jeu c'est vraiment la trame narrative, vraiment trÃ¨s drole, scÃ©nario complÃ¨tement tirÃ© par les cheveux .

Grosso modo l'histoire se passe dans un lycÃ©e, le club vidÃ©o veut rÃ©aliser un film de zombies, mais une vraie invasion de zombies se dÃ©clare, ce qui arrange notre groupe qui n'a pas le budget pour un casting costumes/figurants/effets spÃ©ciaux de cet ampleur . Le scÃ©nario que Blanc dÃ©veloppe est complÃ¨tement pÃ©tÃ© et vaut le coup d'oeil .

On y retrouve quasiment tous les persos Neptunia, Plutia et Uzume dans le mÃªme jeu, que demande le peuple .

Comme dit prÃ©cÃ©demment; gameplay vite limitÃ©, on fait vite le tour, surtout vu le peu d'Ã©quipement Ã  dÃ©bloquer .
Le  jeu peut ne pas Ãªtre compatible avec vos pilotes graphiques et ne se lancera donc pas, personnellement je n'ai rÃ©ussit Ã  le lancer qu'aprÃ¨s mon changement de disque dur et donc la rÃ©installation complÃ¨te de mes pilotes .

SI vous pouvez acquÃ©rir le jeu pour pas cher, il vaut le coup juste pour l'histoire, d'autant que certaines scÃ¨nes peuvent Ãªtre rejouÃ©s avec diffÃ©rents personnages .

author: {'steamid': '76561198431683052', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1268, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1268, 'last_played': 1561345246}
review: It's a very obvious Vita port. The stages are short, the gameplay is limited, and the online is nonexistent unless you have other people you know personally. That said, it is by far the funniest game in the franchise with its constant zombie film and game references, 4th wall breaks, legendary 16th wall breaks, and having full knowledge that they are making the Neptunia Equivalent of The Room. It can be played in short bursts if so desired but you can also sink 6-8 hours into it if you really want to see how it ends. Even though there isn't much to really do in the game I was able to get 20 hours out of it and since it's almost always on sale I find no reason not to recommend it to anybody who is interested.

review:
Tons of fun.  Lots to tinker with.  A surprisingly, all-around robust ARPG system, that compliments the multiplayer function.  -Once you finish the main story, additional options open up that facilitate grinding characters for online.

Four Goddesses is an overall better game, in almost every respect, yet this game pulled me away from it, and currently still holds my attention.

In a nutshell, Fun off, and online.  Best to buy a friend a copy, as random online players are pretty rare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432622447', 'num_games_owned': 37, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 890, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 519, 'last_played': 1598035586}
review:
Before I start the review, I'd like to say: I mostly played the multiplayer, so don't know too much about the story.

Yeah, so this game is pretty fun. I mean, I really can't imagine paying full-price, but it's worth buying if the game's on sale. The combat is decent (it isn't like Platinum Games' combat systems, but it's still good), the graphics are.. okay, considering this was a Vita port. 

The only issue I have is that the game's controls aren't optimized too well if you're using a keyboard and mouse, but with a controller it's fine. 

Too bad you can't change the controller settings. 

7/10 too many waifus

author: {'steamid': '76561198108235797', 'num_games_owned': 4082, 'num_reviews': 550, 'playtime_forever': 1351, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 608, 'last_played': 1566685245}
review:
Let me start with this, i love Hyperdimension and its characters, it's certainly clichÃ© but i love the series itself nonetheless.
But Idea Factory are really getting more and more lazy.
Not only the game is buggy and very badly optimized, loading times are a pain in the ***, but the game itself is just copy / paste from every Neptune game ever. 
Same content as always, and the gameplay is bland, boring and too easy, there is no threat nor any challenge in this game, plus it is very short.
I'm all for an action hack and slash of Hyperdimension, but at least, make it good and somewhat a bit challenging with good replay value, different enemies and different content.
It's getting really annoying to always end up with the same content in each game, party-wise, it's al right, but enemy and other content-wise, it's not okay, they'll have to change their way otherwise i'll just stop buying their games or i'll wait until they'll be like 2$, their real worth.
Because let's be honest, with such bland gameplay, same content game after game, it's not worth much at this point.
Story is kind of confusing and doesn't really make sense at all, its mediocre at best.

Despise loving Hyperdimension, its characters and its story, this game is just not worth it, and if they keep making the same games again and again, none of them will be worth it, so if you want to see a change, stop buying their game full price, they won't have a choice but to actually make new content, new mechanics, new stuff and of course, a better gameplay for those hack & slash games.

4.5/10 - Buy it only when it's about 2$ otherwise forget about it, if you have not played the Hyperdimension games, i'd started there first if i were you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052882776', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 1886, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1859, 'last_played': 1667427341}
review:
Para esta reseÃ±a voy a dar por sentado que has jugado a Hyperdimension Neptunia U primero. 

Este juego es el segundo hecho por Tamsoft. De nuevo perteneciente al gÃ©nero hack'n'slash aunque con muchos cambios desde el primero. Algunos muy interesantes mientras que otros un tanto desagradables.

Empezando directamente por los buenos tenemos el Multiplayer. Como ya te habrÃ¡s imaginado, 3 aÃ±os despues del lanzamiento vas a necesitar contar con amigos para jugar en grupo, sin embargo no te preocupes, ya que todas las misiones se pueden completar en solitario.
Otro cambio muy importante ha sido el hacer que los lily ranks se incremente en solo 1 mision en lugar de 3. Algo de agredecer a la hora de completar el juego por completo.

Tambien se ha modificado la forma en la que funciona el equipo. En lugar de contar con diferentes armas y accesorios, en este juego utilizarÃ¡s armas que a la vez se equipan con idea chips y unos accesorios especiales llamados "parts" que se desbloquean en el multiplayer. He de decir que tardÃ© muchÃ­simo en descubrir como funcionan los chips de arma y casi no he encontrado informaciÃ³n al respecto en internet. Por otra parte, las parts solo aportan unos pequeÃ±os bonus defensivos por lo que al final en lo Ãºnico en lo que te fijarÃ¡s serÃ¡ en el atributo de tu arma y la debilidad del enemigo.

Por otra parte, a los 10 personajes de la entrega anterior ahora podemos sumar otros 4: Plutia, Peashy, Uzume y Tamsoft. Con sus respectivas transformaciones.

Aunque no todos los cambios son buenos. Los combos han cambiado de una entrega a otra eliminando, entre otras cosas; la posibilidad de enlazar facilmente un combo con otro, lo que provoca que la fluidez del combate se vuelva un tanto espesa al quedarse tu personaje demasiado tiempo parado en mitad de una animaciÃ³n final o simplemente por no poder hacer ciertas acciones en ciertos momentos. Desgraciadamente este es uno de los puntos mÃ¡s negativos del juego ya que ademÃ¡s han aumentado la dificultad respecto al anterior tÃ­tulo considerablemente.

Y precisamente de dificultad va el siguiente punto: Esta vez, al subir de nivel nos darÃ¡n la opcion de gastar puntos de atributo en cuatro categorÃ­as: ataque, defensa, salud y combo. Da la casualidad de que si aumentas tu defensa lo suficiente llegarÃ¡ el momento en que ningÃºn, en serio, ningÃºn enemigo del juego te podrÃ¡ hacer daÃ±o. Lo que reduce las peleas a una molestia mas que un desafÃ­o.

Otro punto que quizÃ¡ a alguno le resulte interesante es que ya no existe el costume break. En lugar de ello tendremos los trajes normales y los trajes rotos para equipar desde el principio, y los personajes que no formaban parte del juego anterior no tendrÃ¡n versiÃ³n rota. No es algo que afecte a la jugabilidad, pero quizÃ¡ a alguien le parezca importante a la hora de decidir.

Y la historia: pues como todos los juegos es sencilla y absurda. Vale para echarse unas risas a costa de las voces y caras de las protagonistas y poco mÃ¡s. Hay algÃºn detalle bastante interesante pero que prefiero no destripar.

En conclusiÃ³n: recomiendo el juego por que a pesar de sus fallos me ha entretenido mucho. Sin embargo tened en cuenta que la entrega anterior es muchÃ­simo mejor en la mayorÃ­a de aspectos. AsÃ­ que si no lo habÃ©is jugado tal vez debÃ¡is empezar por ahÃ­ y decidir que hacer a partir de eso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198869874381', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 277, 'last_played': 1581725055}
review:
This is one very good game. Like most of the other neptunia games, the interactions between the characters and the references are genius with the combat being very fun and easy to get the hang of (It also feels really good to string together combos). There are also secret 'backstage talk' scenes that add to the already funny atmosphere with accessories that can let you dress the characters like actual movie characters (I personally have neptune look like some kind of secret agent). But, this isn't a good place to start with the series (play re;birth 1 first). Don't worry about computer specs ether (I'm using a Â£300 laptop and the game runs well, unlike VII.)

Overall, If you haven't played any other neptunia game don't get this one first. But otherwise, GET THIS GAME!

author: {'steamid': '76561198245486910', 'num_games_owned': 640, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1603120246}

author: {'steamid': '76561197972468905', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 85, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1550108706}
review:
This is a half-baked Dynasty Warrior clone dressed up to look nicer than it actually is. It has a great opening sequence. It has funny characters and good artwork. The user interface is clean. There are many things to do, such as getting new weapons and costumes. The gameplay and move combos are done well and I enjoy the silliness of throwing around a stuffed rabbit or teddy bear. 

But the actual gameplay is mediocre at best. The arenas are empty and lifeless. There is very little variation to what you are doing. I feel like this is a half-finished game pushed out before it was ready. I hope they fix this in a sequel, because then it would be worth it. I imagine die-hard fans of the series would still play, but I cannot recommend this game in the current state.

The multiplayer works, but it does not add significantly to the fun factor.
