author: {'steamid': '76561198161658353', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 410, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 410, 'last_played': 1539285611}
review:
This is very strange game.

It is based off the Manga series which has all the CPU'S attending high school. Which I assume translated means an excuse to have girls in school uniform. But that is not the point at hand. This game s about the Film Club headed by our favourate protag (or should that be Neptag) Neptune and she asks Blanc to write a script. They begin to shoot a horror movie but then the students really do become Zombies and everything kicks off from there,

The combat is the exact same as in U, but this time the maps are alot smaller. Each mission is presented a scene and often you will get a different version of a cutscene if you replay a mission with a certain set of characters. The scene don't change dramatically but it can add a joke or 2 or even use the characters relationships for comedic effect.

Although this game is zany and in some areas just downright bokers it actually works. There are many hillarous scenes between Neptune and Blanc, and a sweet Nepgear and Uni scene. There is also a really funny moment between Neptune and Noire afterwards but they two always work well together.

All i can say is this game really asks of the player one thing:
Just Accept That This Is Happening

if you start to ask questions or even attempt to make sense of this game then take some asprin because this game is wacky and fun. I highly recomned and I hope you enjoy it as much as I did

author: {'steamid': '76561198137225922', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1528, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1559253675}
review:
It has Uzume in it. What more can you ask for?

Serious review below

TLDR: Get it on sale. The game is fun, but I don't feel that it's worth $25. You may not be playing it for long, but it's fun while you are.

Misc:
- No FOV slider, 0/10
- Camera can get a bit wonky at times.

Story/Singleplayer: 
It started out okay and fun, but declines in quality at Chapter 6. After that, there was too much filler and I gave up on trying to complete it. There are lily ranks if you wanna grind for that. The lily ranks give buffs, but they don't tell you how much.

Multiplayer: 
- It works, albeit with some crashing here and there. It wouldn't be a Neptunia game without some unexplainable bugs. 
- All missions can be done solo. 
- There are some filler missions, but they are a lot better than the story mode ones.
- You cannot transform in multiplayer because you can just choose the CPU/transformed form to start the missions with.

Gameplay (and some comparisons between Neptunia U):
- The game feels relaxing, as in you won't be swarmed by a bajillion enemies at close quarters all the time. Even when you are swarmed, you won't be stunlocked to death as the enemies attack way less. So when you do mess up, it's your own fault.
- The maps are waaayyyyy bigger than Nep U's.
- You can block now, thereby erasing everything wrong with Nep U.
- Some combos are locked behind leveling up the "Technic" stat. Dunno how I feel about that.
- Charge combos need more love. They leave you standing there without protection and can be easily interrupted (being attacked once), leaving you disappointed.
- Combos can't be interrupted by yourself, which is bad. Stuck doing a combo when the enemy is right about to attack you and you want to block? Sucks for you.
- Bosses and mini-bosses are annoying, just as they were in Neptunia U.
- Some bosses feel like reskins.

Overall, it's an enjoyable game and the positives outweigh the negatives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331335454', 'num_games_owned': 135, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1418, 'last_played': 1588004833}
review:
The CO-OP menu music (EXistence) is one of the GREATEST THING IN THE WORLD!!! Man, this music is just great (At least to me). Anyway, if we talk about the gameplay, it's the same as Hyperdimension Neptunia U's gameplay but improved, so what that means is it's an arena fighter game that has so many characters in it. I'm happy that this game has most characters in Neptunia series and you can customise them too. The plot is so funny to me, it's centred around "It's so bad that I love it" and it's great. Sad part of the game is that it's story mode is super short and it doesn't have the content of the CO-OP mode, this is bad because if you don't have a friend to play this with you then the story mode won't satisfy you. But if I remember it correctly, you can still play the CO-OP mode solo but I'm not sure. The CO-OP missions are great and they are better than story mode missions. Overall the game is nice and it's simple fun.

7.0/10 too much EXistences.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013901762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 460, 'last_played': 1537852532}
review:
After playing almost all Neptunia games on console/Vita, I had to try this weird spin off on Steam. By the way, Im so happy that all Neptunia games have been ported to PC, it really made my life better.
Idea Factory, as the name suggests, is a company that loves to explore and experiment different genres within the same franchise. Hyperdimension Neptunia was a JRPG, while this specific game is an action game. The result? I can't say that it's great but it's not bad either. I don't believe people were actually expecting something from this game, but nevertheless it is a very light hearted game, with a very funny story. The classic lewd moments in the dialogues are here, aswell as the ecchi stuff. The gameplay itself is really pretty straightforward containing some combos and a lot of button smashing. Soundtrack and almost all scenarios are basically a copy pasta from the other games. Also, the way you can customize acessories and adapt them to the characters is kinda impressive, making customization nice.
Well, Zombies is a over used theme that can cause boredom, but it does not matter here. All that matter is NEP NEP.

NEP NEP/10 great game

author: {'steamid': '76561198079613560', 'num_games_owned': 648, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 572, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 495, 'last_played': 1549485983}
review:
I mean, it's a hack n'slash action Neptunia spinoff. What do you expect? The storyline is exactly what you'd expect of a Neptunia game, complete and utter ridiculousness with funny and rarely touching scenes between the characters. If hack n'slash games aren't something you're interested in, you won't like this game. 

But if you enjoy those types of games, give it a try. I'd probably suggest waiting for a sale though.

Also, bonus points: CPUs in schoolgirl uniforms.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106146020', 'num_games_owned': 2110, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 329, 'last_played': 1534649939}
review: This is the first Neptunia game that I haven't enjoyed, and I've played all the mainline games and a couple of the spinoffs. The combat is dull and repetitive, plus the enemies and environments are even more blatantly recycled than usual. Not to mention the story just felt... bland. Not even Plutia could save this trainwreck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069159152', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2420, 'playtime_forever': 206, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1533798430}
review:
This is another of the spin-offs from the Hyperdimension series. In this case, the CPUs (and candidates) have started attending school to learn more about how humanity thinks. But since birth rates are still not increasing (probably a reference to the actual issue in Japan itself), the school will likely have to close.

But Neptune has a plan! Make a zombie movie! Very quickly, Blanc (the protagonist) is roped into writing and directing, and the game pretty much goes from there.

The game has a decent plot and thrilling battles. It is not that different from other Neptunia titles (or for that matter, Idea Factory games).

You might wait for a sale, but I can recommend this title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189590828', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 330, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 104, 'last_played': 1644301997}
review: It is worth the purchase as a hack n slash game with VN properties. Story and characters are amazing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029587520', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 435, 'last_played': 1530996629}
review:
The plot was simple and enjoyable with the usual shenanigans. It focuses mainly on Blanc and to some extent Neptune, everyone else gradually comes along. Main selling point of the game imo, very lighthearted fun.
The gameplay is there to kill time, I personally beat the game with Noire and Plutia and some Tamsoft. Its nothing difficult as long as you upgrade corresponding to when you get your skill points and sword upgrades.
I havent gotten to try the multiplayer yet so no opinion on that as of now.
Recommended if you're invested in the series or want to get into it.

review: MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies (Neptunia), purtroppo, non Ã¨ un titolo molto coinvolgente. Ãˆ l'unico spin-off della serie che NON sono riuscito a portare avanti e completare per via della sua ripetitivitÃ  nel gameplay e una trama banale. Nonostante mantenga l'humor conosciuto nella serie che aiuta a spezzare la monotonia, in questo capitolo Ã¨ troppo pressante da renderlo fastidioso. Il gioco in se Ã¨ un prodotto valido ma che non supera le aspettative e le fondamenta gettate dai suoi predecessori. author: {'steamid': '76561198313465449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 7535, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3327, 'last_played': 1704599540}
review:
I love this game. Nice light hearted and fun story as you would expect from a Neptunia game with some memorable and cute moments. The combat is decent and button combos are not too difficult to master. Only downside is that sometimes it can take ages to find a room in multiplayer just gotta be playing at the right time.

Controller Recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121521491', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 4401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4264, 'last_played': 1588538540}
review:
The story mode is pretty short, but don't mind it. All the fun is in the multiplayer, which unlike people say, not entirely dead. You can still find people to play with and even get a 4-stack. Some combos are long, but simple, it also has aerial combos that you don't use often. Has animation cancels that add to controllability.

And the most important thing is that it has the best accessory system ever. You can place them on any body part, rotate and resize in the most ridiculous ways possible, [url=imgur.com/a/xuPmoAP]like this dude here[/url]. 

Overall good game, tho i'd advise you to wait for sale.

[spoiler] Don't skip the Thursday multiplayer special quest, it gives you 50k skill points for all your characters that will make them ready for endgame even on less than lv20 [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561197961951106', 'num_games_owned': 1565, 'num_reviews': 289, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1528048155}
review:
This is another brawler from the Neptunia universe and I'm glad to report it's better than [url=https://store.steampowered.com/recommended/recommendgame/387340]the previous one[/url] - which was already decent! The gameplay feels better refined, more complex with more of everything. More stat items (weapons) and surprisingly deep customization options. New and interesting characters (â™¥Tamsoft). Better graphics and dialogue art; alternative scenes. It's obvious to me that the developers learned a lot from Action Unleashed and moved to improve their game.

The one thing that might be aggravating are the achievements, but only if you're a completionist. They require significant grinding and also involve multiplayer - which is dead. Since this is a very touchy subject for me, it might have singlehandedly tipped the scales in favor of thumbs down. I didn't go down that road only because a generous player shared their savegames in a Steam guide. Chances are it's still up.

So yeah. This is not a brawler of DMC caliber, again. But it's a solid addition to the Neptunia IP, building it up (don't really care how canonical it is). Also [spoiler]Uni x Nepgear[/spoiler] is [i]even better[/i] than [spoiler]Nepgear x Vert[/spoiler]. I hope this is a thing.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234871376', 'num_games_owned': 395, 'num_reviews': 216, 'playtime_forever': 933, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 933, 'last_played': 1527929397}
review:
Comparing to U Action Unleashed, this game has better story, better combo, and more characters. But the combo is a little bit slower than U Action Unleashed.
Oh, and a nice little plot twist as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086457357', 'num_games_owned': 1222, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1525022035}
review:
Semi-competent fighting game, rather on the easy side, with rather bland and short "dungeons" and a so-so story (the story is very "meta" and tongue-in-cheek, as usual with the Neptunia series but it's not at its best in this game). It's not a bad game per se, but I'm downvoting it, because there are lots of more interesting games around at a much lower price (there are already too many upvotes in steam as it is, so, we must make a distinction between the better games and the not-so-good games).

Cute Nep girls, but that doesn't save the game. Even during sales, you can skip this one in my opinion.
I don't usual finish "Nep" games, so if you're a fan of those, you may think otherwise, though this one is definitely not the best in my opinion

author: {'steamid': '76561198097903526', 'num_games_owned': 64, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1776, 'last_played': 1525724349}
review:
I recommend this game but only if you like this kind of games.
There are 14 playable waifus. The story is silly, sometimes fun, a los of times pointless. The gameplay is fun but not so great. The game has problems with full screen, it crushes. There are only a few people to play multiplayer, so you should expect to play alone. The voice acting was great, I liked a lot, both versions. The game is short, the story takes 5-7 hours, and to complete the rest with all the extras and achievements takes 20 hours more.
So, that sums up my impression of the game. Have fun with the waifus.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041636869', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 187, 'playtime_forever': 2464, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2464, 'last_played': 1523152656}
review:
The latest game from the Neptunia series Iâ€™ve played. This is one of the action games, while I prefer the  RPG / Tactical ones. It is still fun, but I admit I didnâ€™t bother completing all of the achievements, it didnâ€™t grab me enough to be worth spending an additional 10 hours grinding the last items I needed. Some of the bosses had way too many hitpoints, so even though I had so much defense they couldnâ€™t damage me, it still took too long to finish the fights. 

Worth picking up, but wait for a sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198201674099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 4136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 622, 'last_played': 1693762094}
review:
trÃ¨s trÃ¨s bon jeu. Moi qui adore la sÃ©rie Neptunia (NEPU !) Je peut que vous le conseiller !
au niveau du mode SOLO :
- On retrouve tous les personnages de la sÃ©rie "Hyperdimension Neptunia The animation" ce qui est un trÃ¨s bon point.
- Les personnages sont customisable. Vous aimez pas une tenue? changez-la !
- Sur le sÃ©nario c'est du Neptunia traditionnel (scÃ©nario bien Ã©crit, avec un sens...)
au niveau du mode MULTIJOUEUR :
- MalgrÃ¨s la limitation au niveau du multijoueur je peut vous le conseiller si vous et vos amis habitez dans la mÃªme rÃ©gion.
Si vous habitez pas dans la mÃªme rÃ©gion que vÃ´tre ami vous pourrez avoir quelques problÃ¨mes pour trouver sa session.
- Multijoueur stable : Le mode multijoueur du jeu est (pour ma part) assÃ¨s stable. (tant que la connexion reste assÃ¨s bonne et que l'ordinateur de l'hÃ´te ne lag pas en fps.)

Bref, c'est du Neptunia c'est un RPG franchement pour ce genre de jeu je peut que vous le conseiller !

(NEP NEP)

author: {'steamid': '76561198011552490', 'num_games_owned': 432, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1522605459}
review:
Low effort port due no Mouse control support.
Pure KB or controller, is not what i call PC port friendly.
I'm not gonna try to play this game on full KB control (+ not gonna buy a controller for this) which is basically standard seperated in 3 sections:
- wasd + qr (movement+skill)
- ikol (basic attack, jump, etc)
- numpad 2456 (camera movement)
Who has 3 limbs to control this?
Enough said i guess...

review:
mesmo elemento do hyperdimension neptunia u sÃ³ que com mais personagens jogaveis, zumbis e um multiplayer que aumenta a vida util desta serie que desta vez Ã© protagonizado pela blanc (sÃ³ falta gente para jogar online que infelizmente estÃ¡ praticamente vazio).

mesmo que muitos nÃ£o tenham gostado do game, eu faÃ§o questÃ£o de recomendar este game na steam e sim, eu vou pegar tambÃ©m a versÃ£o de ps vita quando possivel!

author: {'steamid': '76561198255360938', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1666, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1508, 'last_played': 1673185683}
review: This is honestly a pretty good spin off for Blanc, even though she may get a little boring sometimes.(At the end the characters even poke fun at that). If you are into the Neptunia series as a whole, I'd recommend palying through this because it still has that Nep game feel to it, lots of good new jokes and good replay ablilty. It's also very fun with a friend, especially spamming voice commands.

author: {'steamid': '76561198075466721', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 287, 'playtime_forever': 2049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2049, 'last_played': 1515885898}
review:
my review for this Masterpiece:

Good:

+ good graphics for a port
+ playable at 4K (game still stretch 1920  to full 4k), fiddle with graphic console settings. and voila great game with 4k smooth graphics....
+ great effects
+ some new cool tracks
+ easy story
+ cool conversations
+ many chars to choose from
+ many new maps
+ online multiplayer
+ interesting cutscenes
+ lovely artwork
+ easy to control
+ great effects and realisation of movements
+ new Monsters
+ good customizeable accessory (resize, make bigger etc.)
+ interesting chars with many variations in fighting styles (all have there ups and downs)
+ Blanc, Iris Heart, Black Sister, Uni, Dengikiko
+ best Zombie voices from voice actors (best is Dengikiko)
+ great japanese voiceover as ever (english: just NO)
+ cool background and visuals as ever
+ cool soundtrack
+ easy navigation in menues
+ all in 4k greatness, looked so much better then the native 1920
+ much to laugh about 


Bad:
- some screen tearing
- fps drops from 60-50 sometimes
- minor crashes
- multiplayer is pretty easy
- some audio tearing

as great as the game is. it is sure short. i am a slow player and finished around 25 hours the storyline. 100% gameplay was finished in additional ~15 hours or so. i hope next time the gameplay gets a lot bigger. Neptunia U was great too and this game is great too. the graphics are smoother, movement too. but you need a good pc to cover the medium port. i give the whole game 95% it sure is great....

author: {'steamid': '76561198155870927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1515124211}
review:
Computer Specs:

AMD Ryzen 7 1700 CPU
AMD Vega 64 GPU
32GB RAM
2TB Mushkin Reactor SSD

Cannot run the game past the second level of Chapter 2. It just freezes and crashes the moment I gain control of whichever character I select. I know the system requirements say that the game may not run well on AMD processors but this lack of optimization is just plain unacceptable.

Impressions (of the limited play-time I had) from someone new to the Neptunia franchise: English voice acting is rather bad, like "one person does most of the characters" bad. Story is mostly just there as an excuse for the gameplay to exist, and the AI is really dumb. Controls are loose and combos have no "feel" to them. Startup takes a while due to all the logos that will play before you get to the Title Screen. Needless to say, I'm getting a refund.

review: If you're looking for an introduction to the beat 'em up genre, look no further - as MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is a prime choice for just that very purpose. That said, anyone else may have a hard time finding a challenge, and the story just isn't all that cohesive or memorable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198408109317', 'num_games_owned': 439, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 455, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 455, 'last_played': 1511774968}
review:
Idea Factory and Compile Heart games have a notrious reputation for being low-effort, and what do you get if you take their most popular Neptunia franchise and make a spin-off? The most medicore low-effort forgetable game.

Neptunia games live and die off their writing and even though the actual quality is rather debatable Megatagmention hits a very low point. The plot tries to sell its self on its cast trying to save its high school by making a zombie movie using the current sudden zombie outbreak to attract more students. It really, really tries to get into that its so bad its good category and ocassionaly there is a gem, but at all other times its meh.

Graphicaly the game looks exactly like a PSVITA game because that's what it is, and it rather bland forgetable environmen.ts. Enemies in the main campaign are a first for the series but repeat very often, while the multiplayer mode takes enemies from Action Unleashed.

Musically the game is average; some tracks such as the menu theme are above average, and transformation music for Neptune and co. are quite nice, but nothing sticks out compared to the previous mainline game Megadimension, so you won't be hearing anything on the level of 'Will be Venus' or 'Dimension Zero'.

Gamplay wise, this is where this game really shows its lackluster design. Basic hack and slash mechanics are there for all the characters, which can all perform one or two combos each, and can transorm to change up their small moveset slightly. MegaTagmention controls relatively well, combos have weight and moves are satisfying to pull off, however jumping feels very heavy and unnatural, and the double jump timing is very strick. Characters have a dodge technique whcih blasts them across the field at the speed of sound, but feels highly difficult to aim. Besides basic combos, guards and counterattacks also exist, however they can be slightly difficult to activate due to the unoptimised controller layout straight from PSVITA. Characters have 4 special attacks that they can use when their SP Gauge fills up and these can be very useful for crowd control. Characters can bring two allies into battle which can be used via a button combination that can boost attack, defense, restore HP, restore transform gauge or other effects. You'll quickly discover all you need is transofrm gauge recovery and HP recovery.

Your transformation gauge is charged by hitting enemies, and when it is filled to half or more you can transform into the CPU or a more souped up form of your current character that has different combos, different SP moves and is more powerful. It can also be used to perform powerful EXE and Lily attacks (attacks based on your bond with a different character, raises the more you fight with them). EXE attacks however have a severe oversight where they will knock enemies out of their combos, meaning it will do a fraction of the possible damage.

The two characters you chose into battle when they win (or lose) will gain experience and a boost in their Lily Rank plus money and drops, which presents a problem for the short 6-7 hour campaign. Characters that you don't use won't level up meaning that if you want to use them you will have to grind them up, meaning you will keep sticking with your tried and true character combination. This would be more of a problem if the game wasn't so easy. Enemies largely sit around and look pretty, there isn't much variation in big enemies besides hit and dash, and the game doesn't even feature a proper boss until the end of the campaign! Map design is very small and linear, and largely doesn't effect the way you fight foes. Due to the game featuring more then 10 characters in its short-campgin you won't get bored until the end.

Money can be used to buy weapons, patches, and visual accessories at the store to applly to those weapons to give to your characters to buff them making fights easier. Patches and drops can be fused together to make even better patches, and drops you obtain from mission can be used to unlock costumes for your characters. This system is rather basic, but can be fun to play around with. However, buying weapons reinforces using a minimal amount of characters for your playthrough.

From my brief 1 hour experience with multplayer, enemies from Action Unleashed are back providing much needed variety and 6 big proper bosses that should of been in the main story, alongside a use for your much stronger weapons. Multiplayer gets rid of allies, Lily attacks, and bring two characters in exchange to work together with 3 other players, being able to freely revieve them, and to use a character pre-transormed or that one in the base form unable to tranasofmr. Due to the higher difficultly, better play is required but not too much. I had no connection issues, and the communicatioon menu provided gives a wide range of options to say phrases that translate to other languages well. 

In closing, MegaTagmention Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is a medicore hack and slash game that doesn't feature anything noticable of interesting. It plays perfectly fine with some minor quips with controls and physics, but the story is very, very weak, with few funny moments typical of Neptunia games. Idea Factory and Compile Heart have showed they can make quality games with the release of Megadimension Neptunia VII, but they haven't followed through with their efforts with spin-off games. Skip this unless you are a big Neptunia wee-I mean fan AND only if it is on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972223413', 'num_games_owned': 1246, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1771, 'last_played': 1527082315}
review:
So it took me about 24 hours to play and beat it completely, other than some achievements. By that, I mean Triple SSSing everything in singleplayer and multiplayer, and when I went to check my rank is 267 so not bad eh?

I mean, its fun, theres some customization but not a lot. I mean, if I was going to go and get all the achievements and level every character to 99 then sure it might take longer but I feel I can say I've beat everything the game has to offer. I got it on sale for five bucks, so not a bad deal for the amount of time I invested in it. But, content wise there's not a lot here. Not a lot of enemy variety, not much of a story, the maps arent very big, the combo system is pretty easy to master.

I typically avoid fighting games... and this one was still kinda fun like I said. I dont know if I could recommend it at full price so wait for a sale if you really want it, or look around for other places and not just on steam to see has the best deal.

author: {'steamid': '76561198094633170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 482, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 462, 'last_played': 1588242450}
review:
MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is a Hack and Slay game like Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed was. But there are some differences between those two games. MegaTagmension has a bigger selection of characters than Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. The combat also feels faster which made this as a Hack and Slay a lot more enjoyable. The quests you do don't just take place on a big stage anymore where you have to defeat a bunch of enemies but rather on a bigger area where the enemies are sometimes scattered throughout said area. But this only applies sometimes to even rarely. Most of the enemies spawn at the same spot as you do and most of the quests can be done on this said spot. Most of the quests take place on bigger areas but most of them don't use them effectively as you only have to fight your way through the enemies at one spot. Because of this most of the quests can be done in under one minute, which also feels kinda odd when they are giving you a time limit of 30-60 minutes. Also there isn't much variety of the enemy types you are going to face. The enemies you fight at the beginning are also the ones you are going to face throughout the entire game. This also applies to all of the bosses except for the final one of course. If you get the hang of these bosses you will most likely get bored to face the same bosses over and over again. On a positive note. All of the characters you are able to play feel different and you will most likely find one that suits your playstyle best. But there is also one problem with leveling those characters. You unlock more characters as you make your way through the story of this game. The problem with that is that all the characters that join your party at a later point are at a very low level and you either have to grind with them first to use them on the current quest you have to do effectively or just ditch them and stick with the characters you used up to this point. Also the amount of EXP you get for each quest isn't as high as it used to be in Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. It feels like you don't get enough EXP for each quest. To level up even once you have to do the same quest multiple times. So if you want to beat the story as fast as you can it may be best to stick with the characters you get at the beginning. The last point I'm going to talk about is the story. The story is enjoyable but it's not very good. To keep it short. Blanc and her friend are trying to make a movie to save their school. While they're filming a zombie virus is spreading all over their school and they have to take care of that. That's all you need to know for now. All the characters behave the way you expect them to behave and the setting is pretty refreshing for a Neptunia game. After you beat the story there isn't much to do anymore. You don't unlock additional quests or challenges. You can only play through the story missions again.

In conlusion the game is best suited for you if you are fan of the Neptunia franchise and enjoyed Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. The dialogue is pretty funny and the game uses original music aswell as music from previous installments. The game has it's flaws but it is also very enjoyable. But due to it's short playtime I would recommend to buy this game on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198108296385', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 2929, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2811, 'last_played': 1503879788}
review: Compared to U: Action Unleashed, I enjoyed this game much better. MegaTagmension has more characters to choose from, more upgardes and customizable features for your characters, more levels in the campaign mode, and a multiplayer mode so you can play with your friends. I'll admit that the story feels a bit forced and doesn't make much sense and like any hack n' slash game the play style can get boring rather quickly but if you can catch this game on sale it is definitely worth a buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136545980', 'num_games_owned': 352, 'num_reviews': 94, 'playtime_forever': 335, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 335, 'last_played': 1509219541}
review:
this game is a disgrace of Neptunia series, it's simply not fun. the voices in menu are driving me crazy - every single button press plays a voice which is annoying. pressing together X and Y? who the hell thought it's a good idea?! The story mode is EXTREMELY linear, Neptunia U at least had some side missions to play between advancing the boring story, to make it worse all missions are on the same tiny maps over and over again, they are very short like 2-5 minutes each, the AI is dumb.
The story? Neptunia characters dressed in school uniforms are making a crappy zombie movie, that's it.
And as a cherry on top, I had some technical issues with game stuck at 20fps and everything was 3x slower than normal though it fixed itself somehow. $30 for this? nice joke. A total kusoge, it was made for handheld but still a kusoge.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999935168', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1190, 'playtime_forever': 522, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 522, 'last_played': 1512316500}
review:
After 5 unskippable startup logos and a intro cutscene you have to skip each time, probably over a minute worth of garbage when you launch the game, you get to play a pretty fun game. The game's only fault I can think of is that missions take place in small areas and everything gets repetitive but the game has an amusing story and of course characters that are well known and liked among fans. The upgrade system works. The super moves are over the top awesome and always cool to watch. The character and outfit designs are great. The artwork is funny, like how some of the enemies you fight include the actual green pipes from Super Mario as enemies among other weird stuff. The sound and music are good and the controls with a xbox 360 controller are pretty solid. Playing online is fun too. I found someone to join my game and we played for about 2 hours straight just doing missions and leveling up.

8/10 Just don't tell anyone I play this k thanks.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296468109', 'num_games_owned': 214, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 1804, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1788, 'last_played': 1510637333}
review:
This game is sure a mixed bag of good things and bad things when you look at this game. Many people say itâ€™s a bad port and I can see why, since half the enemies just stand still till they attack you.

Pros:
Fun online Co Op
Great accessory customization
SO MANY WAIFUS TO CHOOSE
A decent shop to buy stuff from
A nice level system to upgrade ATK DEF HP and learn new moves
Decent replayability with the treasure to collect.
Weekly missions
Many cloths to wear
Epic boss battles

Cons:
Shitty campaign
Really fast combo meter so itâ€™s hard to keep
Shop could have more items IMO
The full price 30 is way too much!( that's why I got it on sale 40% off)
You will need guides to get every achievement

Final rating is a 8/10
Much NEP and loads of cute waifus!

author: {'steamid': '76561198168776606', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 232103, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 88919, 'last_played': 1701599399}
review:
If you enjoyed any of the Neptunia Series, then you will like this one

[i]MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies (Neptunia)[/i] gameplay is quite different from the other Neptunia games. As the others were turned based, this one is a hack and slash style much similar to Hy[i]perdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed[/i], which if you loved that one, then you WILL also love this one

Not much I can really say, I haven't played much of the game yet, but i can guess it can be like Action U where it is really fun at first but might get tedious, repetitive and boring as you reach higher hours.

But if your love for Nep is true, then I'm sure you can find ways to make the game more fun

I give this game a 8.8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198060684664', 'num_games_owned': 1084, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1509186982}
review:
Pros:
- All the characters from the previous games come together for a fun and quirky side story.
- Combat is fun when you get the hang of it.
- Fully voiced dialog.

Cons:
- Very short.
- Some of the cut scenes still use the Japanese dialog.
- Terrible keyboard+mouse controls.

Overall, 7/10. Great game to pass the time but definitely too short for $30 price tag. Get it on sale. Don't bother getting it if you don't have a controller though.

review:
This game feels a bit crude around the edge in term of gameplay, with each mission performable solo and within a minute or so. The story is nice, the goddesses are cute as per usual. Control can feel a bit sticky at times. Net code is horrible and there are trophies that requirement multiplayer to obtain, according to the discussions. Should only consider buying if you are a fan of the series.

Gameplay: 2/10
Story: 6/10
Characters: 10/10
Music: 8/10
Control: 2/10
Multiplayer: n/a (Haven't attempted.)

Overall: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198155690831', 'num_games_owned': 665, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1039, 'last_played': 1501285929}
review:
A game about lesbian anime schoolgirls fighting zombies? What could possibly go wrong?
A lot of things, actually. While the main series are RPG games this one is just a button mashing Hack â€˜n Slash game in which your character is placed in an arena and need to defeat hordes of enemies. Some of the arenas are just circles and others have a few corridors leading to some open areas but there isnâ€™t anything to explore at all. Just go after the zombies and thatâ€™s it. While at the first glance the combat system seems to be somewhat interesting in the end you will end up only spamming the same moves over and over again because the game doesnâ€™t really encourage you to change combos and try something new. Just spam the moves you think are more powerful and thatâ€™s it. That said, the game gets repetitive fast and the story doesnâ€™t help much. While some of the dialogues are actually fun the whole thing isnâ€™t something that make you want to pay attention because it is actually poor. The game, just like in the original series, works with the level up system but now this time you actually need to distribute the points in the attributes you want to upgrade the most. And wellâ€¦ the balancing of this thing isnâ€™t really good since if you just spend all your points and max out the defense attribute your character will be almost immune to damage, something that is a game breaking feature that should not exist outside the cheats (that you unlock after beating the game) That said you can make this game be painfully easy, just making things even more boring. Just like in the main games there's an item shop where you can buy new weapons and wellâ€¦ just buy the strongest one and thatâ€™s it. You donâ€™t really need to plan anything since in this game, unlike in the main series, the weapon you wield donâ€™t really changes your combos in any way. If thereâ€™s something in this game that I think it was a nice addition to the series is the customization. At the same time it is a bit too simple the game allows to resize the accessories and place them wherever the heck you wish. Like, literally. If you, for whatever reason, want to place a wrist watch inside the character's head, you can. If you want to shove something into their buttholes, you can also do that. If you want your character to have a giant hat flying upon their head, take a guess. YOU CAN! You can even pretend to be in TF2 and make a towering pillar of hats. But the customization isnâ€™t only limited to accessories, you can also unlock different variations of the characters main outfit and, if you want, you can also use a torn-up version of their main set of clothing so they will fit more to the zombie apocalypse scenario. (We all know you will actually make your characters wear that for other reasons) The graphics are ok when it comes to the playable characters but the scenery is way too bland. Ahh, whatever, nobody plays Neptunia games for the graphics anyway. The soundtrack is mediocre at the best, you might just want to put something else to play on Spotify. There aren't many glitches to mention but one thing that is annoying is that the game sometimes stop working when you boot it up on full screen. I really recommend you to play the game in windowed mode so this problem wonâ€™t annoy you.
In an overall this is just a mediocre Hack â€˜n Slash game that can only please Neptunia fans since it features a lot of different characters from different games and if you donâ€™t even know who they are I donâ€™t really think youâ€™ll enjoy the game at all. And I can only recommend this game if itâ€™s part of some sale since it doesnâ€™t worth its full price.
[spoiler] Iâ€™m only giving this game a positive review because it did turn the NepGear x Uni ship into something real! [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198068726043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1530, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1524, 'last_played': 1552607507}
review:
When I first started hearing about the Hyperdimension Neptunia side games, at first I was looking forward to them as a fan of the series and everything about it. Then felt rather disappointed when I started seeing the content of games like Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed or Hyperdevotion Noire: Goddess Black Heart. I felt like all they had to deliver was either over the top fanservice, which I'm not really okay with, in the series (I don't mind fanservice as long as it's not over the top, in this case) and... I don't think that having a tsundere character as a protagonist is a good idea. I feel like there's little to go with. And I really love Noire as a character. But like... particularly with Neptunia U. The way I see it is the following: "Ripping clothes in combat? Really? What am I playing? A Hyperdimension Neptunia game or a Senran Kagura game?"
What I can say is that my view on the Neptunia side games I'm aware of changed when I heard, saw and played MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies. This game ACTUALLY has something more to deliver, even if it's not much.
The game was released in 2015 in Japan and at the time, only for the PS Vita. Then a year later in North America and Europe. And got its Steam release that same year, in October 3rd.
[b] The story [/b] **SPOILERS AHEAD**: [spoiler] In order to learn more about humans, Neptune and the other CPUs have been attending classes, at Gamicademi. Neptune, Noire, Vert and Blanc are seniors, with Vert and Noire being the Student Council President and Vice President, Nepgear and Uni being juniors and Rom and Ram are in Elementary school. At this point in the story, Gamicademi is under the threat of being closed, due to birth rates being declined. Neptune, being the academy's Film Club president and wanting to save the school, she decides do make a zombie movie to submit it for a contest, along with the help of Blanc's sisters, Rom and Ram. While filming a scene for the movie, Blanc spots them and thinks they are being attacked by actual zombies, intervening and beating the crap out of them. After that, she is told of what's really going on and is asked by Neptune and her sisters to work with them, declining at first but then agreeing to work with them as long as she's the director and she's the one writing the script. What they didn't realize is that they accidentally summoned actual zombies into their world. Seeing as an opportunity to shoot scenes, Blanc takes advantage of the situation to help everyone saving the school and make the movie. Problem is, they don't have enough people to make the club official, so their activity is not exactly allowed by Vert and Noire. That is until they get more people to join them. Tamsoft, a fellow senior, agrees to work with them and enter the movie. And later on, so do two others, Dengekiko and Famitsu, the two Gamicademy reporters from the junior class, who have a rather lively rivalry towards each other. With enough people working with them, they decide to go Vert and Noire again to make the Film Club official, which Vert allows and decides to join them too, but Noire still doesn't really support the idea, not showing much faith in them and not wanting them to make themselves look bad. Later on in the game, Blanc finds a video on the internet which pretty much was the reason why Noire didn't want them to go through with the movie, as it's really embarrassing to her. She then joins Blanc and the others as long as Blanc keeps quiet about it. A few scenes later (the chapters are called scenes), they finish the movie and submit it. Though this isn't where it ends, as there's still the zombie problem to deal with. Though seeing as there are still zombies in the academy, Blanc takes the chance to write a sequel to her rather random movie, though her and the others start wondering about getting more people for the movie. Later on, Uzume arrives at Gamicademy as a transfer student and looking for the source of all the zombies, being later revealed to be an entity known as HachimaJin. With the purpose of her presence being made known, Uzume joins Blanc and the others to film the 2nd movie and to search for HachimaJin. But Blanc is still looking for more people since only one more person isn't enough. Neptune gets Plutia, another fellow senior whom is punishing a bully in her rather infamous HDD form when she is introduced. Rom and Ram get Peashy, whom is also in their elementary class. Now with enough people, they continue working on the movie while searching for HachimaJin's whereabouts. After being almost done, they realize that there's only one place where they haven't looked. A classroom which, according to Vert, shouldn't exist. The girls decide to go there to conduct their search and shoot the final scene. That's when HachimaJin shows up to them. The girls eventually defeat the entity and with that, they also finish the movie and things slowly go back to normal. Sometime later, they finish the editing of the 2nd movie, though they keep it to themselves as a memory. On that same day, they also get the contest's results, which gets a place in the honorable mentions. [/spoiler]
The story in itself... is nothing really special. It's not something memorable, but not something forgettable either, taking around 19-21 hours to complete.
[b] The gameplay [/b]: If you've played Neptunia U or some of the Senran Kagura games, you won't spot that many differences. If you didn't, then here's how it is. Unlike the main Hyperdimension Neptunia games, this game is pretty much a hack and slash. You have a total of 14 different characters to play as which are unlocked as you progress through the story and their transformed forms make it a total of 28 characters, which you get after you beat the story. Each with their own style of gameplay and special moves, some requiring more dexterity than others. But once you get the hang of their combos, the gameplay turns out to be what's probably the best part of the game. Though don't get used to having every action assigned to a single button press. Certain actions require small button combinations, so read the tutorials carefully.
This is also the very first Neptunia game to feature Multiplayer. Co-op, in this case. So if you got three more friends with the game, gather round, set up a room and have fun. It's worth it if you're hunting collectibles, which unlock mostly just outfits for the characters.
[b] The graphics [/b]: For a port of the PS Vita, I'd say the graphics look rather decent. It retains the art style that has always been used for the series and I never really encountered any graphical glitches in the game.
Lastly, I should mention the sountrack, which is a mixed bag. Not in a bad sense, though. While it re-uses tracks from previous games, MegaTagmension also has a few tracks of its own. But nevertheless, the music is always really enjoyable.
So with that taken care of, it's time for the final score. Which, in my opinion, is a 6/10. It's slightly above average. I honestly wish I could give this game a higher score, but I can't. One aspect cannot carry the whole game on its own, no matter how good the gameplay is. While the graphics are decent, those don't make the game perfect. And the story could be a lot more memorable than it is. Even so, that shouldn't be a reason to not grab this game. If you're able to, get it and give it a shot. You won't regret it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198015357478', 'num_games_owned': 256, 'num_reviews': 159, 'playtime_forever': 534, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1503420805}
review:
If you have previously played other entries in this series, you know what to expect. The main difference in this game is the gameplay being more of a hack 'n slash instead of turn-based. However it can get a bit repetetive and boring, unless you have the right equipment it can be enjoyable.
Personally I found the story to be much more interesting as it was less filler compared to the other games. It's filled with references to other movies and shows, and it have ZOMBIES. The soundtrack is without a doubt the best part as it's amazing.
Sadly it's too short and you can finish it around or under 8 hours, playing normally.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269556450', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2244, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1709, 'last_played': 1540268986}
review:
MegaTagmension Blanc+Neptune vs Zombies  Ã© mais um jogo spin-off da saga Neptunia, na qual muda-se o gÃªnero, e ele Ã© novamente um Hack n' Slash, como o NeptuniaU, mas dessa vez o jogo se passa em uma escola, sim, suas waifus de colegial com tema de zumbi e trazendo a possibilidade de se jogar online. Lembrando que nessa anÃ¡lise, comparaÃ§Ãµes diretas serÃ£o feitas ao seu sucessor espiritual, o NeptuniaU.

     O jogo comeÃ§a com a Blanc(que agora Ã© a protagonista) falando que nessa dimensÃ£o, as deusas que eram muito prÃ³ximas aos humanos decidiram ir Ã  escola saber mais sobre a cultura humana. E tambÃ©m fala que a academia iria fechar por conta da baixa natalidade, causando a falta de alunos. ApÃ³s isso, corta pra uma cena na qual as 4 deusas estÃ£o juntas e a Vert, que Ã© a presidente do conselho estudantil, falando que a Gamicademi(a escola delas) fecharia no final do ano, a Neptune fala que o jogo acabou de comeÃ§ar e que ela nÃ£o iria desistir. Inicia-se entÃ£o o capÃ­tulo 1, que comeÃ§a com a blanc na parte de fora da escola, lendo um livro, atÃ© que que ela ouve gritos de suas irmÃ£s. Ela vai ver oque Ã© elas estÃ£o sendo atacadas por zumbis, ai comeÃ§a-se a primeira batalha que serve mais como um tutorial. Enfim, apÃ³s a Blanc meter a mÃ£o na cara dos zumbis, a Ram pergunta porque ela fez aquilo e a Rom pergunta se os zumbis, que na verdade eram alunos vestidos estavam bem, Blanc ja nÃ£o estava entendendo nada, mas aÃ­ Nep chega e explica pra ela que elas estavam fazendo um filme para salvar a escola e pede ajuda da Blanc...ela recusa, mas a Nep consegue convencer ela, dizendo que ela escreveria e dirigiria o filme. ApÃ³s isso, comeÃ§a o capÃ­tulo 2, que comeÃ§a com elas em uma sala e a Nep apresentando os membros do clube, que sÃ£o...ela mesmo, a nepgear, a Rom e a Ram, e a Blanc...que seria o quinto membro, ela vÃª que oque a Neptune tinha feito atÃ© agora era sÃ³ colocar coisas aleatÃ³rias  e decide reescrever todo o filme, apÃ³s um pouco de conversa, a Tamsoft, nova personagem...entra na sala perguntando se elas estÃ£o gravando e que tem zumbis la fora, elas dizem que nÃ£o e vÃ£o ver os supostos zumbis, ela percebem que sÃ£o zumbis de verdade e a Blanc tem a ideia de usar esses zumbis na gravaÃ§Ã£o buscando deixar o filme mais realista, e Ã© aÃ­ que o jogo realmente comeÃ§a, com os objetivos de fazer o filme, salvar a escola e descobri porque os zumbis estavam ali.

     Bom, a histÃ³ria assim como a do NeptuniaU nÃ£o Ã© das melhores, mas a desse jogo Ã© um pouco melhor, oque eu ja esperava ja que esse nÃ£o Ã© realmente o foco do jogo. E vale lembrar que ela se passa em dois momentos, um deles Ã© elas interagindo e conversando e a outra seria a gravaÃ§Ã£o do filme, com elas atuando.

     Mas agora vamos ao que realmente interessa, o jogo em si. E a primeira coisa a se falar Ã© sobre os movimentos do jogo, esses que foram acrescentados alguns em relaÃ§Ã£o ao outro jogo, nos podemos correr, alternar entre ataques fortes e fracos, dar um "dash", pular, usar skills e skills especiais,trocar de personagens na batalha, travar a mira no inimigo(esse que tambÃ©m serve pra mostrar a vida dele), defender, usar um suporte(esse que eu falerei depois), usar itens, alÃ©m de se transformar. No jogo assim como no NeptuniaU vocÃª escolhe uma missÃ£o(as missÃµes irregulares foram retiradas) e nela vocÃª pode escolher 2 personagens, mas agora sÃ£o 14 personagens e mais suas formas transformadas(vocÃª pode transformar normalmente, mas com isso vocÃª pode comeÃ§ar com elas transformadas), essas que sÃ£o liberadas apÃ³s o zeramento, cada uma com suas respectivas individualidades, e outra...o jogo agora nÃ£o te obriga a jogar com todas as personagens, ja que o jogo nÃ£o faz vocÃª jogar determinadas fases com determinadas personagens, vocÃª pode jogar todas as fases com sua personagem favorita sou a com a personagem que vocÃª joga melhor, que Ã© oque eu aconselho, eu por exemplo joguei a maior parte das missÃµes com a Tamsoft. Ah! E aquele negÃ³cio de rasgar a roupa quando leva dano tambÃ©m foi retirado D:, Ã© uma pena.

E agora, falando sobre os personagens de suporte, esses que sÃ£o paralelos aos que vocÃª usa nas batalhas, agora vocÃª pode usar eles para ganhar perks durante as batalhas(como ataque, defesa, ou etc), vocÃª pode escolher 2 deles. Os cenÃ¡rios do jogo melhoraram se comparado ao seu antecessor, mas eles estÃ£o em menos quantidades, pelo menos na campanha, sÃ£o escolas, cidades, florestas...mas nÃ£o Ã© possÃ­vel  visualizar muitos detalhes ja que basicamente vocÃª nÃ£o vai se movimentar muito nele, ja que vocÃª vai ficar basicamente em um lugar matando os monstros.

No menu do jogo, a Blanc fica do lado interagindo com oque vocÃª vai selecionando lÃ¡, caso vocÃª nÃ£o faÃ§a nada, ela vai ficando entediada(bem legal kkk). No menu temos o "Action", que serve basicamente pra vocÃª jogar a campanha, "Setup" que serve pra vocÃª equipar os itens, mas aqui temos algumas mudanÃ§as, primeiramente nas armas, que agora vocÃª pode equipar um "perks" nela(como mais ataque, mais vida pra vocÃª, etc), a customizaÃ§Ã£o do jogo Ã© a melhor da sÃ©rie, agora alÃ©m de mudara a cor do cabelo e roupa(com itens que vocÃª ganha), vocÃª pode equipar acessÃ³rios, esses que podem colocados aonde vocÃª quiser na personagem...vocÃª pode colocar um chapÃ©u no pÃ© da personagem por exemplo, se vocÃª quiser, no Setup vocÃª ainda pode equipar as dark parts, essas que vocÃª ganha no multiplayer e tambÃ©m usar pontos de atributos para fortalecer as personagens, vocÃª pode distribuir os pontos em Vida, Ataque, Defesa e TÃ©cnica, essa que serve pra vocÃª desbloquear novos combos, pois nem todos sÃ£o liberados no inicio do jogo(essa Ã¡rvore que eu aconselho mais vocÃª investir), no menu ainda pode-se acessar a opÃ§Ã£o "Treasure", um Tesouro, que serve como aquelas moedas do jogo passado, tambÃ©m tem o "Shop", a loja do jogo...lÃ¡ vocÃª pode comprar itens(armas, itens de fortalecimentos e aqueles perks das armas), vender itens e tbm fundir itens, que serve tambÃ©m para aqueles perks de armas, finalizando sobre o menu, vocÃª pode ir em "Config", configuraÃ§Ãµes do jogo e "Exit" pra sair do jogo.

Aquele negÃ³cio de Lily Rank, continua aqui que serve para aqueles skills de dupla. A campanha ta bem curta, em cerca de 8 a 10h vocÃª pode finaliza-la, mas ela tem uma coisa especial...vocÃª pode mudar algumas personagens de algumas cutsceenes no jogo, em algumas fases se vocÃª colocar determinadas personagens na party, por exemplo, em uma parte do jogo, no filme que elas estÃ£o gravando, vai aparecer uma policial...que Ã© a Uzume, mas, se vocÃª colocar na fase 8-1 a Uni e a Vert, essa policial vai ser a Uni...bem legal. Nesse jogo assim como no outro estÃ¡ REPLETO de loadings...loadings pra tudo que se faz...e tambÃ©m tem aquelas informaÃ§Ãµes, que dessa vez em vez de informaÃ§Ãµes sobre a personagem em si, vem informaÃ§Ãµes sobre o gameplay com ela, se ela Ã© rÃ¡pida, se ela Ã© lenta, etc, etc.

E finalmente falando sobre o diferencial do jogo, o multiplayer...esse que pode ser jogado em atÃ© 4 pessoas, e ele tem algumas diferenÃ§as da campanha normal...aki vocÃª tem que derrotar os "grandes chefes", esses que nÃ£o encontrados na campanha, com o objetivo de encontrar aquelas dark parts, e alÃ©m disso nÃ£o Ã© somente esse o conteÃºdo exclusivo do multiplayer, temos novos mapas, inimigos e etc, e alÃ©m disso Ã© mais dificultado, ja que vocÃªs tÃ£o em grupo. VocÃªs ainda tem o lobby na qual serve como um Menu. O Ãºnico problema, Ã© nÃ£o ter um chat, a Ãºnica coisa que tem Ã© uma espÃ©cie de mensagens prÃ©-selecionadas na qual vocÃª pode mandar mensagens do tipo "Bom trabalho!" ou "Sim", "NÃ£o","vamos mais uma!", mas como sÃ£o muitas mensagens, nÃ£o tem muitos problemas de comunicaÃ§Ã£o...mas seria melhor um chat mesmo. Sobre bugs, o Ãºnico que realmente deu foi o jogo crashar.

MegaTagmension Blanc+Neptunia vs Zombies Ã© mais um Ã³timo jogo, e mais um bom spin-off da sÃ©rie, com a oportunidade de multiplayer que deixou o jogo Ã© melhor, e que pode nÃ£o ter uma histÃ³ria muito boa mas isso nÃ£o atrapalha no jogo. Antes de terminar nepnep>>>>all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200519807', 'num_games_owned': 857, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 61272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 993, 'last_played': 1561610861}
review:
Nep: The Zombie Slayers. 
Blanc will be the director and producer for this game's story.

+Simple game, just nep every enemies that appear in map (Actually this series is like Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed).
+You can nep with the other players in multiplayer mode.
+Plutia and Sadie are available as playable character !!!
+6 Steam Trading Cards are available.
+And of course this game is still NEP SERIES !!!

-Story is too short. Singleplayer mode can be done in less than 4 hours.
-Pause system is not friendly.
-Update program system is very confusing,
-This game still have bugs, especially at opening (when enter Tamsoft intro, don't click/skip, or the game will crash).

Still recommended: nep/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198125113321', 'num_games_owned': 2707, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 1661, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1421, 'last_played': 1502809103}
review:
[h1] It is faith [/h1]
All characters are cute 10/10.
This story is talking about Blanc. She wants to be famous so she joins Neptune's film club and become scripter and director. Their school nearly closed. They want to make something to protect their school. Therefore, they are making a zombie film.
The plot is good. especially [b]Magical Noirina [/b]
I love Blanc and his sisters.
The game is easy. However, I think the recovery time of Blanc is quite long. Well, she is using a heavy hammer.
The loading time is reallllllllly long.
The default camera position is quite weird. It is not a big deal though.

-easy
-nice plot
-Faith
-Cute character
-long loading time

7.5/10 for game
11/10 for waifu

[spoiler]No one will know if I take someone[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198093065929', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1106, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1089, 'last_played': 1500096779}
review:
First off the game could run on a potato, mind you if your graphics card is bad the intro can be a little laggy and/or crashy, but only the intro screen. Using Intel HD Graphics I can get a steady perfect framerate in game. The multiplayer is a slight bit glitchy as I found out when playing with a friend that if your connection gets spotty the multiplayer server breaks until one person leaves.
The multiplayer was probably my favorite part of this game as the storyline caused me to cringe uncontrollably and it ruined the singleplayer for me but don't let that ruin it for you as I cringe at things that some people might find funny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198315228874', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 1883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1857, 'last_played': 1499208403}
review:
Good Game

Story is about 8hrs long
100% Achievements and gear is about 30hrs

Story is kinda meh lost interest half way in but stuck it out because the characters are 10/10 and you wouldn't want to miss what happends between 2 of them , no spoilers.

Multiplayer is a different mode then story. It carries over what you get in story but its a different menu selection with new maps. Its a little slower with people then soloing it as enemys scale. You must wait for host to pick quest and everyone to rdy up. But you have lots of fun voice recordings to spam in that time. Then wait for people's potato computers to load. Then there are a few bugs when people leave. Its a good start for future games. Not the best or even good multiplayer but its neet to play with others. Prob best to play with a friend but not needed. ( You can password protect your games )

I would not recommend this for multiplayer or for people new to the game series. But for all dedicated fans its a decent short game and worth picking up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055744458', 'num_games_owned': 1589, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 364, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 364, 'last_played': 1498357611}
review:
I like the HDN games and this is my least favorite in the series. Way to short, i beat it in 6 hours. It plays a lot like Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed which is actually a good game and I'd recomend that over this one. The missions in this game are so short its insane. You will beat each mission in 20 seconds to 2 minutes tops. 

The story was meh. I tuned out about half way through the game. Feels like a complete cash in on the fans. Way to little effort was put in on this game. I bought this on sale for $7.50 and i still feel like i paid to much. 

If you are a fan of this series and want the gameplay like this one. Skip this and go get Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. If you already have it go play it again and save your money. Its a much better game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198200718251', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 206, 'last_played': 1517169527}
review:
AGH so hard to say bad things about these games...but its so full of bugs. Once played things stop working and just crash :( I actually really like this game and loved all the other Nep Nep games but the frustration of having to re-start the game is too much. I have 2 bugs that make it impossible to play properly: 1. Game freezes and won't launch unless I sit through all the intro stuff cause if skipped it just crashes 2. Can no go into the in game shop, game just crashes completely so I can't progress without buying new weapons ect. 

I never thought I would give a negative review for one of these games but honestly it isn't worth buying at all, nvm on full price. Too many bugs.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069750929', 'num_games_owned': 1773, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 1575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1562, 'last_played': 1530496168}
review:
Blanny Blanny B is ready to direct a movie full of cuties and zombies. What's not to like here?

The amount of character customization available in this title is amazing. Short skirts. Short skirts everywhere! I had a lot of fun dressing up my Magical Idol Girl Noirina to a new level of Waifu.

The online play is fun, my girlfriend and I spent a lot of time doing all of the online challenges after we completeled the single player story. If you have nobody to play with, don't fret. You can do the online challenge levels solo quite easily.

This was deifnitely an improvement over Neptunia U: Action Unleashed, especially since they didn't include the Lily Lord achievement this time around...

author: {'steamid': '76561197969019449', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 368, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1496618795}
review:
Wait for a sale on this; the shallow gameplay and barebones plot is not worth full price.  Action Unleashed accomplished more with the Dynasty Warriors-esque gameplay than this game did, and Action Unleashed is already a hollow example of the genre.  If there's any scenes worth grinding for, they're overshadowed by all of the incredibly short missions that barely manage to cough up the same palette-swapped enemies over and over again.

Blanc deserved better than this.

review:
HonnÃªtement je suis trÃ¨s dÃ©Ã§us de ce Megatagmension, qui s'offre le mÃªme style en quelque peu remaniÃ© de HN Action U.

Le jeu est bien moins intuitif que d'ordinaire et certaines commandes ont disparues (comme le panneau qui donnait les touches Ã  faire pour lancer les diffÃ©rentes attaques spÃ©ciales en cours de combat)

Les maps sont plus grandes et surtout plus vides que jamais, dommages.

Moins de plaisir de destruction massive car les ennemis sont beaucoup moins nombreux que dans Action U.

Le gameplay est plus nerveux qu'avant (surtout avec Uni), on dash dans tous les sens, on vole comme des furies, toutefois les enchainements sont moins faciles Ã  mettre en place, vous Ãªtes vulnÃ©rable quand vous les faites, il y a un temps d'animation maintenant ce qui rajoute de la difficultÃ© mais qui retire un peu au plaisir de jeu selon moi. 

Enfin ils ont ajoutÃ© une commande pour bloquer les coups, merci.

Le gameplay a perdu un peu de son charme mÃªme si il s'est Ã©toffÃ© un peu, je pense qu'il mÃ©rite encore quelques ajustements avant d'avoir vraiment LA bonne recette.

En ce qui concerne l'histoire : elle est trÃ¨s bonne, trÃ¨s drÃ´le comme toujours, mais avec une durÃ©e de vie pitoyable pour un HN mÃªme si la rejouabilitÃ© est bien lÃ , je n'apprÃ©cie pas la mÃ©thode utilisÃ©e qui consiste Ã  refaire l'histoire Ã  tour de rÃ´le avec les autres personnages pour dÃ©bloquer les scÃ¨nes inÃ©dites, tout comme monter le lily rank vu le nombre de personnage c'est juste du farm no brain top long et bourratif, surtout que je m'Ã©tais dÃ©jÃ  bien embÃªtÃ© sur celui d'avant pour le lily rank alors refaire Ã§a ici non merci Ã§a suffit les conneries.

Ce jeu dispose d'un multi qui n'est plus jouÃ© et qui n'a que peu d'intÃ©rÃªt, il n'a pas d'autres modes de jeu.

Pour le prix en toute franchise il mÃ©rite tout juste un pouce bleu, j'espÃ¨re nÃ©anmoins qu'ils feront mieux que Ã§a la prochaine fois "errare humanum est, ced perseverare diabolicum est".

author: {'steamid': '76561198025807060', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 568, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1494662659}
review:
I will give you a brief overview of the plot.

This time "for some reason" the goddesses are highschool students.

That reason being, schoolgirl outfits I'm sure... And in this school, there is a film club. In previous games Blanc has always been pegged with the trope of being a reader and being a creative writer. So, this outing, which is accredited to her, she is the film club "writer" and she narrates the "story" but this is not all, the film club is doing an amateur film about Zombies, at the same time as there is an actual Zombie outbreak at their school.

So, the anime-girl-anthropomorphised console wars have done a spin off game where they are high school students, who are making a zombie film, at the same time as a zombie outbreak. Simple eh, I don't know why some people may think these games are not accessible!

It pretty much follows as a cookie cutter of Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action unleashed, without the gratuitous "clothes breaking", and a couple of new features and tweaks to levelling up.


All this additional stuff is good, but I had way more fun on Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action unleashed. And its down to one very superficial reason, loading times.

It's so slow, I checked it out and its a know issue for the PC version, but I find it frustratingly long, and especially for a game which places you in a fast paced action environment, the change of pace seems obnoxious!

As much as it pains me to "dislike" a spin-off game about anime-girl-anthropomorphised console wars, where they are high school students, who are making a zombie film, at the same time as a zombie outbreak. I cant forgive those loading times.

author: {'steamid': '76561198219004332', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 601, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 534, 'last_played': 1499612996}
review:
Before i get into my review, let me say this, unless you are big fan of the neptunia series, don't get this game.
P.S. I'm quite a big fan of neptunia thus the positve review.

Story
The story is light and easy going, it features the characters going through a sort of "normal life" with a bit of zombies, which the zombies are treated almost like a joke, which is sort of fun to watch. But if you are expecting the usual hillarious comedy from the neptunia series, sadly this game doesnt have such a comedic touch. But if you are here see a chance of Blanc being an MC, you have come to the right place

Music
The music for the game is nice, it does fit every scene quite well and I enjoy the music.

Gameplay
For this part, i have to admit, it is horrible. First, the enemy lock on function is broken, it is hard to even lock on an enemy, which means it is hard to hit an enemy without a lock on. But then even so, there is another point, the enemy attack patterns are properly, they look like dummies that just sit there and wait for you to hit. The whole gameplay is sort of repeatative as there is not much diffrence between the enemies which most of the time i just mash "Y" for Rom, without using any of the other combos.  The maps are also not fully filled and mostly reused.

Art
Reuse, Reuse, Reuse
A lot of art assets are heavily reused, from the enviroments to enenies. The reuse rate of art assets for the enviroment and the enemies is 10x worse than in usual main series. 

But as for the character wise, the art is quite good as usual, and also you have a pool of accesories to choose from, and customizable on the x,y,z axis of the characters, meaning you can place wherever you like. But i do see complains that the clothes choices are limited compared to its Hack and Slash precessor Neptunia U.

UI
For UI navigation, I have no complains about this, the UI is easily understanble and I can navigate through it with ease.
But compared to the usual neptunia UIs, this game has terrible UI Art Design, The whole UI of the game looks like it came from student project. The Design of the buttons looks a bit plain and bland in my opinion, could have done better.

Overall i would still recommend the game for Neptunia fans, the game has potential, but just too many issues within it.
Game: 7/10
Story: 8/10
Art: 7/10
Gameplay: 5/10
Music: 9/10
UI: 5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198043607189', 'num_games_owned': 1496, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 134, 'last_played': 1495686201}

author: {'steamid': '76561198170159766', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1617434889}
review:
Beautiful design, but incredibly shallow gameplay. It is rather too simple for its own good and "missions" are over before you know it. I don't mind if this game is meant to be lighthearted since the plot is quite lacking, but it could have been made up for with better gameplay. Instead, what you get is battle after battle that don't feel any more challenging than the last and last significantly shorter than endless pointless dialogue.

Only fans of this fan servicy series will enjoy it for its quirks and humour, some of which I did smirk at at the beginning, but got tired of real fast.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998146124', 'num_games_owned': 4530, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1328, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1666240572}
review:
It's similar to Hyperdimension U Action Unleashed, except the characters aren't stripped to their underwear during battles.

It's a bit more complex in having to pick items before a battle, buying weapons and other items.

The story is silly as usual, the game is waaaaaay too short. I finished story mode in 3 1/2 hours.

I strongly suggest only getting it on sale for $10 and under. There is no way this game is worth more.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116940865', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 202, 'playtime_forever': 2609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1655, 'last_played': 1614212634}
{'steamid': '76561198047545462', 'num_games_owned': 619, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1921, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 762, 'last_played': 1561718493}
review:
If you enjoyed Nep U, then I would highly recommend that you play this.

Pros:
Same style of combat to Nep U albeit with a few changes to how certain moves are pulled off
Great 4th wall breaking story we have all come to love from the Neptunia franchise
More characters than Nep U
Hours of content

Cons:
many models are reused from Nep U
Soundtrack is mostly reused tracks from other Nep games(but what is new is of a high standard)
(For some people) It is a game heavly reliant on grinding so that may put some people off

I would definite recommend this but would suggest getting this when it is on sale as the price tag may be a bit too much as though it has plenty of content, it has nowhere near as much as main series Nep games.

Have fun Nep-nepping!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198144303447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1470, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1436, 'last_played': 1555894130}
review:
A typical hack and slach game, just mash buttons and you'll likely win. However I absolutely loved the story, it does not make much sense but that just adds Nepness to the game! And Blanc is the main of the game, what more can you ask?!

Game mechanics are pretty simple but great. You just need to mash the buttons to win but must still defend and run away from enemies if needed so there's stil some tactical gameplay going on despite being minute,

Characters and humar are the best selling point of the game. If you've played Nep games before you'll no longer need to understand anything because... welll... Neptune. For those who are new to the series there game is absolutely great is you want a hack and slash game. Missions are too short however to my liking, I finish some missions in under ten seconds so for people who are looking for a challenge this is not the game for you. The point of the game is to just bash some zombies dead and continue to the next take. The story and humor of the characters are the things that bring the fun in this game.

Overall, I absolutely loved this. Much better than Neptunia U!

author: {'steamid': '76561198066402732', 'num_games_owned': 2098, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1480420417}
review:
Personally, I was pretty disappointed in this game, as I was expecting a big improvement to Hyperdimension Neptunia U, but that's not what it is... It's not really a bad game, just completely different than what I was imagining/hoping for. :(

They did improve a few points, though, so I'll say a few things I think they did better and worse and stuff.
First, the better: [list]
[*] I liked the added customization options for the characters (the accesories, mostly) and weapons, it was a pretty cool addition to be able to make them feel more personal.
[*] The support characters are pretty cool and add some more options.
[*] Multiplayer is a cool idea (I haven't personally tried it myself yet)
[/list]
Neutral? (I guess):[list]
[*] The leveling system/skill upgrades are kind of cool, but with the normal combos requiring certain levels of upgrading to fully perform, it's part of combat's clunkiness (mentioned more later)
[*] The story and missions aren't very coherent, but it's pretty funny and all, so that's fine.
[*] The Clothes Break from U is no longer in, I usually just used sturdy clothes in U once they were unlocked (more family-friendly and all) but it was a cool idea that defense would lower and ability recover rate rose when your clothes broke. [spoiler]And the animations were dang cute, I'll admit.[/spoiler] Now the broken clothes are just one of the outfits.
[/list]
The worse:[list]
[*] The combat is much clunkier, skills are harder to use (need to defend in order to use a skill, so the fluidity is messed up) and no longer customizable (and you can't see which skills you can use like in U, so you have to either memorize them or hope the one you chose works well)
[*] The controls in general don't seem to work as well, in my opinion (I always have to check how to transform and stuff when I come back because it's different than U. And there's items in this that I rarely, if ever, use since it's annoying trying to choose them during battle...
[*] There's a lot of stuff missing that was in U, like equipping different skills and the three stat-changing item slots, etc.
[/list]


Overall I'd still recommend it, just don't expect Action Unleashed 2 or anything, which was what I was thinking.

author: {'steamid': '76561198032137848', 'num_games_owned': 1957, 'num_reviews': 775, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1488527494}
review: This one is a bit lacking on the gameplay front compared to the baseline neptunia games, but is still pretty funny. If you enjoy the humour in the other Neptunia games, you'll enjoy this one. breathes new life into the series by taking the game in a completely different direction from the standard JRPG route, and instead builds upon what was learned in Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. A solid character action game with fun gameplay throughout and a multiplayer mode that adds a lot of value to the game.
