author: {'steamid': '76561198159935337', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2040, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1941, 'last_played': 1489780737}
review:
I like to do a review after completing  a game in 100%. The same I did here in MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies.
I had a lot of fun playing alone and with my friends.
Story mode is really funny and multiplayer even better (as long you can find someone to play with which may be hard sometimes). Some people say it has bugs and crashes but I haven't experienced any so far.
Soundtrack is nice (Rock/Electronic music) and also this game has full English dub...but still I prefer Japanese


Blanc/10 - must play if you're Neptunia fan (especially Blanc)

author: {'steamid': '76561197979100343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 2683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2683, 'last_played': 1485188647}
review:
He terminado el juego con el 100% de los logros y me gustarÃ­a dejar constancia de lo que me ha parecido.

CÃ³mo juego es bastante entretenido, la historia es bastante graciosa, el diseÃ±o de personajes es bastante chulo, el sistema de juego (a pesar de pecar de ser un poco repetitivo) es divertido, puedes mejorar la estatisticas de tus personajes y cambiarles la apariencia. En definitiva es bastante completito en ese sentido.

Las cosas en contra al menos desde mi punto de vista son que tiene mapas bastante grandes pero no se aprovechan casi nada por que lo Ãºnico que haces es buscar la pelota de bichos a masacrar y ya, cÃ³mo todos los juegos japoneses se premia el hacer los escenarios a todo correr en vez de hacerlos "bien", los tiempos de carga son un infierno, tarda una eternidad para jugar escenarios que te van a durar cÃ³mo mucho un minuto y medio, los jefes son cÃ³mo mucho sacos de golpes con patrones de ataque muy simples y fÃ¡ciles de sobrepasar, 

Ahora hablo desde mi experiencia para sacar todos los logros, es un soberano coÃ±azo. Los drop rates de algunos objetos (tesoros y partes oscuras) son una locura, para ver todas las escenas tienes que salir al menÃº principal con sus pertinentes pantallas de carga, el logro del combo de 5.000 golpes lo tuve que sacar con uno de los truquetes que hay por alguna guia que han colgado en la comunidad, lo mismo tuve que hacer para sacar el logro de matar a todos los enemigos y conseguir los tesoros.

Ahora si me preguntaÃ­s Â¿recomendarÃ­a el juego? os dirÃ­a que si, pero esperarÃ­a a alguna oferta de 7-8 euros, pagar mÃ¡s cÃ³mo hice yo me parece tonterÃ­a.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050384087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 322, 'playtime_forever': 1190, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1488374840}
review:
Es el Hyperdimension Neptunia U mejorado con Blanc como protagonista y luchando contra zombies. 

Ahora puedes mejorar a tus waifus preferidas con puntos de habilidad, hay objetos de personalizaciÃ³n y ahora estÃ¡n Plutia y Peashy como personajes jugables. 

Lo mejor de todo es que incluye multijugador para 4 jugadores, perfecto para darle mas horas de vida de juego, ya que la historia es corta comparada con el U. 

Lo unico malo que vÃ­ es que hay problemas con la pantalla completa, el juego se congela de mala manera si inicias el juego en pantalla completa. Tienen que sacar un parche para solucionarlo. Ah, y que a las chicas no se le rompe la ropa.... pero sigue teniendo el modo cÃ¡mara ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°)

author: {'steamid': '76561198031589482', 'num_games_owned': 319, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1533389686}
review:
Needless to say much, it's probably one of the worst port for a Neptunia game. I've bought & played every Hyperdimension Neptunia franchise they have on Steam pronto, and this is probably the worst one yet among all due to multiple issues in the game. (Based from personal experience.)

1. Skipping the Intros on fullscreen makes your game goes into a 24/7h blackscreen & freeze until you reboot your whole system.
2. [b]Extremely[/b] hated the fact that playing in 1080p HD resolution will make the game crashes more easily & more fps drops.
3. Multiplayer is unstable & [b]Region-locked[/b]? What the fuck IF.
4. The Deluxe pack contains 8 cringy [b]English-only[/b] voice ringtones and JP voices was never included. [strike]Who the hell plays Neptunia in [b]English[/b]?[/strike] Bad way to advertise their content without letting us know that there won't be Japanese voices in it.

Conclusion, it's a terrible port. Avoid it if you don't wanna experience a buggy/broken gameplay, even from this. Otherwise, if you're a hardcore fan of the franchise, go nuts.

Edit #1: Giving it a thumbs down doesn't change the fact that it is still a bad port, love you guys for being denial. <3

Edit #2: Not allowed to say bad things about English dubs, or I'll be [b]nep-nep'd[/b] by the Nep fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198148714206', 'num_games_owned': 77, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 2489, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1005, 'last_played': 1589604924}
review: I've been excited from the first time they announce this game and it isn't disappointing. This game have been evolved from Nep U:Action Unleashed, the first Nep series Hack n Slash. MegaTag gives us a vibe from Nep U with a ultimately new enjoyment, Multiplayer. This time around, Blanc and Nep with others character are schoolgirl who films a indie movie for their school that nearly shut down while fighting zombies. [spoiler]For the story, it's bit lack of content and idea than Nep U but for[/spoiler] the gameplay is surprisingly nice and breathful. The game split into 2, Story and Multiplay. You can't play the story mission with others but you can easily indulge yourself by Nep jokes and you can choose any character from start if you play on Multiplay. Overall, this game is nice one but short in content yet you can easily find yourself return to play even if you already finished the whole game. One thing is that this game has something to be unlocks, so try to beat the game fully. Rating for MegaTag that I give; 10/10 for gameplay but there is more room to improve, and 5/10 for story that lacks something from it predecessor.

review:
MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies Ã¨ un po' come mangiare del junk food con la consapevolezza poi di otturare lo scarico: per quello, a modo suo e a piccole dosi, Ã¨ anche divertente. Come da tradizione della saga, non Ã¨ un titolo per avanguardisti o snob da cattedra: approssimativo, demenziale e ripetitivo fino allo sfinimento, malgrado tutto per un po' riesce addirittura a intrattenere, ma solamente mettendo il cervello sottaceto per qualche oretta. author: {'steamid': '76561197982999023', 'num_games_owned': 477, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1482008636}
review:
First of i want to tell you (the reader) that I never had played any games from the Neptunia "universe". I know some of the characters from 4.chan /vg/ but as i said i have no real clue who is who. I really looked forward to test this game since i thought to myself that it looked kinda fun - and well a coop mode is something i really enjoy in games nowadays.

The games i normally play are team based FPS games like CS or if we talk about a diffrent genre - the Souls Series (since most RPGÂ´s like TES games are to casual for my taste). Since i am a huge anime fan this game got my attention - but well i never gave it a "go"

Now lets see how the game plays and feels to someone who never played anything in this genre/universe before.

After i started the game i looked at an intro that had a catchy song â€be my zombieâ€œ and introduced me to the characters of this universe - the intro feels a bit like watching a good anime opening - from the quality how its made.

Intro 9/10

The "main" menu had a average amount of ingame settings that i could adjust (pretty basic but still all i needed).
rly like the orginal jap voice acting but dunno why i like the english voice actors so much

Settings 7/10

Sine i normally watch animes in english sub - i started the game with the orginal voice acting - that was very fitting to the characters of the game. Still - i switched to the english voice acting mid game and this was very good to.

Voice/Sound 9/10

When i started playing the story mode i got briefed about the story of the game and got small and quick tutorial missions where the player learned the "basic" controlls of the game. I had some problems in the beginning tho - i know the Souls Series have pretty bad controlling but this was "hard" for me at start (i had problems with the lock on enemy funtion)
Maybe i was just not used to this controll "scheme". That was the only thing i did not like about the game but still its about learning (as in the Souls Series) - "Git Gud?!"
I liked the Story behind the game, but since i donÂ´t know that much about the characters and universe i have to skip this part - i would recommend you reading other reviews below mine - for this part at least.

Controlls 4/10 (if you get used to them i would rate them 6/10
Story 8/10 

About the Art/Visuals of the game i have to say - i really enjoyed the parts where the characters talked to each other - the feeling of reading an manga came in my mind. The 3d "gameplay visuals were pretty basic - nothing special, nothing bad.

Art 8/10
Visuals 6/10

Well then mid game i tried out the coop part and well this one was very fun - best part of the game for me ( i just love "jolly cooperation"). You can play the entire story mode with an friend or with a random person online. So no further comment from my side for this part of rating.

Coop 10/10 (i had no connection problems at all - played from EU with NA friend)

I still have to finish the game and well i am looking forward to do this plus all the unlocks you can get for each of characters. 

So Would i recommend this game? Yes

My final rating for MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies will be an 7,5/10 (the controlls part was the part where it could had reached an 8 easy but well as i said thats the only thing i did not enjoyed that much.
I am looking forward to play more games that take place in this "universe".

/cheers

Law.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121520825', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1547, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1599667401}
review:
*sigh* You know I am actually a huge fan of the Hyperdimension series, even the spin-offs like Hyperdimension U: Action Unleashed were great! And I kind of hoped, that Blanc+Neptune vs Zombies would be equally as good as Action Unleashed, especially giving the great ratings it got and the similar looking gameplay. Honestly I dont understand why many people say its so great, it is in fact very disappointing. Barely any unlockables or game modes, outfits are only color swaps most of the time and the story is... painfully cheesy, doe that one is intended so it makes it quiet funny.
I will summerize the Pro and Cons for a better overview.

Pro: 
- Full Hyperdimension Neptune cast
- Colorful and funny dialogues like in the other games
- A tiny bit of fan service
- Cheesy as heck, but still very enjoyable
- Co-op mode

Cons:
- Barely any unlockables
- Short story, without much content
- Not able to restart levels
- Characters control like tanks, go down in a few hits doe
- Sooooooooooooo many Looooaaaaaadiiiiiiing screeeeeeeeeeeeens
- Locking onto enemies is weirdly difficult
- Characters are unable to move when hit or untill their move animation is over (like swinging the weapon), 
   making them a very easy target
- Transforming in battle or leveling up makes almost no difference when fighting
- Bulletsponge enemies
- Unlockable outfits only color swaps most of the time

Overall rating from my side: 5/10

If you are a fan of the series and you can find it for like 6 - 10 bucks or so, then get it. It does have funny cringeworthy moments. But if you hope to find the same variety of content or fun like in the other titles, Im afraid you will be disappointed aswell. To everyone new to the franchise: Start with Hyperdimension Neptunia Re;birth1 or Action Unleashed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035630539', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 901, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1549137642}
review:
This game was a letdown for me. It's a very weird and watered down version of action unleashed. Controls for items and that are awkward, and if you weren't paying attention to the batlle tutorial, well you'll end up like me... Beating the game without transforming or using any items lmao. The story is super short it seems. Worth 8$? Yeah, but only if your an autistic fan like myself. Worth 32$? Fan or not, no. 

It has Famitsu, Dengekiko and Plutia, which makes me super happy. But I seem to be almost done the game and I still don't have Plutie... She's probably an unlockable.

author: {'steamid': '76561198282349862', 'num_games_owned': 252, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1401, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1398, 'last_played': 1493904185}
review:
It's a fun Nep game. If you love Neptunia humor and characters then you should get this, especially if it's on sale.

It's a simple but fun hack&slash, plus you can play it with other people online too! The character customization is too simple for my liking tho'.

Overall, if you want a great hack&slash game, but doesn't know anything about Neptunia series, then this is not for you. The main charm of the series is its quirky, wonderful characters. This game doesn't show much of those characteristics since the story mode is kinda short, and the gameplay is not as great as other hack&slash like Koei games or Basara.

But if you're a Nep fan, then what the heck are you waiting for? Iris Heart is in it, that's more than enough of a reason to buy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197984176522', 'num_games_owned': 2116, 'num_reviews': 101, 'playtime_forever': 576, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 576, 'last_played': 1481319412}
review:
[h1]Liked[/h1]
[list]
[*] Has Nep Nep, but Tamsoft is best waifu in this game. Sorry Neppy.
[*] Fast progression, grinding not really required.
[*] Accessories are customizable. Want to wear a hat on your foot? Go for it, I will not judge.
[*] Scenes are infinitely replayable if your heart so desires.
[/list]

[h1]Disliked [/h1]
[list]
[*] No Compa
[*] Many combos end in an air jump, which is worthless as attacks do not fling enemies into the air.
[*] Far fewer enemies on screen than Neptunia U.
[*] Must go back to the main menu, quitting the game, to see scene unlocks.
[*] UI for button actions are gone. This is great, but it should have been optional
[/list]

author: {'steamid': '76561198002525149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1931, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1518066106}
review:
While the controls feel a bit finnicky still, I feel like this is overall a more polished version of the sort of game Hyperdimension Neptunia U Action Unleashed was trying to be. It pulls the action-hack-and-slash gameplay off more elegantly and the characters in general feel more balanced. For instance, ranged characters are no longer effectively god mode.

The plot is about what I've come to expect from a Neptunia title: The goddesses attend school to try and understand humans better. There's a zombie outbreak. So they decide to film a zombie movie while resolving the zombie outbreak to advertise the school.

This game includes multiplayer, which is pretty fun and a bit chaotic. It has a Monster Hunter Lite feel, especially with the bigger bosses.

The only honest complaints I have about it is the farming required for some of the Treasure items, which gets repetitive when you only need 1 item that drops from 1 boss and wind up doing that boss 50 times. This is especially annoying for the multiplayer mission-specific treasures.

author: {'steamid': '76561198181200775', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 717, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1711775362}
review:
3rd game I got from the Nep Nep Fandom, and probably my first hack n slash I got into.
This game story is rather interesting. A bunch of goddess going to school and doing a movie. What could possibly go wrong? Nice plot turning, and some peoples might complain about the lack of seriousness, but he? That is what make the Neptunia serie great for me, and if you can't live with it, you are in the wrong fandom.

-The inclusion of Tamsoft and some characters of the main series, which were missing in Action Unleashed, made the fighting more interesting. Sometimes I just find myself button mashing until I find a usefull combo.
-The inclusion of the fan service from the previous Hack n Slash of the serie made it a bit awkward, as I didn't play Action Unleashed before this game, and didn't expect they give the Costume Break as a costume from the start.
-For the Multiplayer, its rather dead but still worth it if you know peoples actually playing the game. Its also a great way to break the main story and raise your character with less grinding (in the case you play online with someone who is farer in the game).

Even if some peoples complain about the gameplay, I find it pretty neat and a good addition to the serie. I recommend this game for peoples of the Fandom, but you can start with this one if you want. I would say one should rather play the main serie, then go on Action Unleashed before playing this game, as you shall then understand who Dengekiko and Famitsu are, and why the latest slap peoples faces with a giant lobster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018402834', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1003, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 812, 'last_played': 1481882549}
review:
Everything about this game is shit but it has cute girls and multiplayer so I've played for 15 hours so far.

Specifics on things that are shit:
-Lousy combos
-Repetitive missions
-Most missions take less than a minute while loading screens take 30 seconds
-Equip upgrades are never explained and make no sense
-Tutorial is a colourful slideshow info dump
-Best girl Uzume is rubbish in most situations
-Usable items are useless
-Jump arc feels like moving in 400x earth gravity

author: {'steamid': '76561198059209750', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4665, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3925, 'last_played': 1482040907}
review: A good game to pass time and get addicted to know it. Also, you can play multiplayer with your friends. On the down side, the multiplayer don't have alot of people so you are pretty much solo-ing the multiplayer quest (MP).

author: {'steamid': '76561197963833125', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1868, 'last_played': 1490549371}
review: Ok, I havn't played co-op version of this yet so this is my thoughts on the single player. So I beat the game and then went threw all of the levels again and got an SSS on every single fight. The game has alot of eye candy but mostly for the perverts out there. . . Not that I mind. I think I fell in love with Neptune. . and don't get me wrong I had alot of fun playing this game but I really didn't care for the drawn out story and the short battles. I just wish the game brought more to the table. thats all there is, long drawn out story(crappy one I might add) with stills that move there mouths and then short battles that are far too easy. I'd guess on co-op the battles would be even easier! The Girls have great movments and you'll get plenty of "fan service" and maybe an aqward boner while playing dress up with them (You can put items exactly where you want to). Just think they should have put more into the fighting then the lame story. get this one on sale!

author: {'steamid': '76561198152826226', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1516858877}
review: Si has jugado el Action U, este juego mejora (en parte) algunas mecanicas de este. Los combos son mas dificiles de hacer en comparacion del action U y los enemigos no son tan debiles como lo eran en Action U. Otra cosa es que no todos los combos estan disponibles desde el principio sino que tienes que invertir puntos AP que consigues subiendo de nivel para poder desbloquear mas combos lo cual lo hace un poco malo porque al inicio del juego no se puede hacer mucho. Pero en aspectos generales es un buen juego y ademas con el humor que caracteriza a la saga Neptunia.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143207181', 'num_games_owned': 416, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 835, 'last_played': 1491923275}
review:
Se vi Ã¨ piaciuto il NepU action unleashed, questo fa per voi.
La sensazione di deja-vu vi attanaglierÃ  per buona parte dei combattimenti, i controlli sono stati un po' sistemati, ma non aspettatevi stravolgimenti. Credo ci sia ancora strada da fare per parlare di gioco davvero ottimo.
Non Ã¨ il musou definitivo insomma, ma un buon gioco sicuramente!

Resta comunque un prodotto che se trovato in saldo, da fan della saga, prenderei al volo. Immancabile se siete fan di Blanc, che qui Ã¨ main character.
Se non siete fan della saga non credo sia il titolo adatto con cui iniziare, meglio partire con i vari re;birth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198276871649', 'num_games_owned': 438, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1555621211}
review:
The Neptunia Games have always been a matter of whether you love the games or just straight up hate them. I'm more in the middle but that's for another topic.

Let's get this review out of the way: How did this game came to be you may ask? Simple answer - take Hyperdimesion Neptuina U, give a zombie makeover with a zombie story, add the schoolgirl genre because it wouldn't be Japanese enough right and take everything that made U fun and throw it all away and you get this. A fast paced hack and slash that's quite slow to be honest especially compared to Senran Kagura and Hyperdimension Neptunia U which are much faster paced and are actually fun to play. 

The story is about as ordinary as any zombie based story is: the school is infested with zombies(it's actually a play but who's paying attention to this badly written story)and it's up to the Neptunia Cast to stop them(Loose sense of the word). And that's where all the problems begin - the zombie thing has been done to death(pun intended)by the Western World to the point all you need is zombies and BAM! Instant money(coughcough The Walking Dead coughcough). So the makers of this game(must be on something high)thought they can input their ideas into the genre and added the most cliche thing ever: schoolgirls(because it wouldn't be Japanese if it didn't have them). The game has crashing problems when changing the screen size or just changing the screen to full size which is retarded as hell. The story is a snooze and the shop menu(for buying weapons, why am I telling you this, no idea)doesn't work and does this freezy thing(music plays in the background but you can't see anything!!!)causes a crash where the game sorta hits a freezy moment until you press B(I use a gamepad. Obvious reasons)

They took the one thing that made U slighty more interesting: the clothing break system. Thats bad when you consider it's made by the same people who did U and Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus. Sucks when you think about huh?

Through and through the game isn't as bad as the haters say but it's too far from good like the supporters of the Series say it is. You can definitely find a better game out there, so keep looking and pass on this title.

P:S - I loved Neptunia U and I really wanted to love this one too because I have a love/hate relationship with the Main Series because they're turn-based and I'm not a fan of turn-based combat. But I really can't recommend this even to the diehard fans. If you have to get this game, get it for the PS Vita. You'll thank me by not getting it's crappy PC Port(which seems to be the trend for PC Games made this year: all of them are crappy)

*Breathes out.* Finally. That's over. Peace!

author: {'steamid': '76561198170103289', 'num_games_owned': 151, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 851, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 849, 'last_played': 1480389931}
review:
This game is a nep game. Not much else to say. its fun. and the character interactions are great. I have not played HDN:U so i cannot compare the two but the gameplay in this game is Sub - Par. its not great but not so horribly dull that you will want to stop playing. Leveling up and building your character feels great, though i kinda just leveled up one character... by the time i got what i wanted i was already op with nep... in short singleplayer is gud, is fun, gud game. now most people (including me and my friend) saw the coop part of this game and thought. Yes. The coop is, well, not boring, but not the best, if your wondering no you cannot play through the story in coop. Instead you go through a series of missions varying in difficulty. and i have to say... they are really easy, like, wow... though to be honest the whole game easy. connectivity is a problem sometimes to, occasionaly we wont be able to connect to one another for no reason but i didnt expect better. Overall i give it Nep/Nep if you adore the interactions between characters of gamindustri this game is for you, if your looking for a ARPG with coop, this is not the game for you. im not good with reviews, but i enjoyed the game.


Side Note: DO NOT PLAY THIS GAME IF YOU DONT HAVE A CONTROLLER

review:
This game really deserves the "Most bugs fixed with updates" award.
Without changelogs it is actually hard to tell which bugs.
I was able to actually find that one crash bug was actually fixed(when searching for lobbies with password set to "Any")

Aside from that, this game is a good time waster. You come home braindead, call a friend: "hey, let's nep!".
And then you play this game with blank mind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107851282', 'num_games_owned': 157, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1506806336}
review:
Perhaps this game will suit only the true fans of the game series Neptuia,as the game itself is rather monotonous and get bored.But for me this game was special because it added multiplayer,it really is possible to have fun with friends.Will list the pros and cons of this game.
+Interesting idea about the zombie.
+Added new characters,which was not in the game Hyperdimension Neptunia Action Unleashed:Plutia(Iris Heart),Peashy(Yellow Heart),Uzume(Orange Heart),and Tamsoft.
+Multiplayer.
+Nice atmosphere.
Now the cons.
-Uncomfortable camera.
And perhaps all I am mostly satisfied with the game.
Why I'm not talking about the graphics?Just because I don't like to judge a game because of the graphics,for me gameplay is important.
My rating 9/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020438964', 'num_games_owned': 474, 'num_reviews': 153, 'playtime_forever': 640, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 640, 'last_played': 1477607874}
review: Ahhh, console video games (or vidcons as I call them), the ultimate medium of expression, able to convey any emotion from hatred to love, loyalty to fear, all in front of your eyes. Ah, and with lovingly crafted art, music, and the ability to control the action, vidcons are the ultimate combination of the high arts. While I tend to play the stoic, I will be the first to admit that vidcons have driven me to cry, to scream and shout, to feel actual hate; such is the power of this force beyond our wildest reckoning. And here I am, before you, to tempt your tongues with the taint of such a tantalizing topic. And the Japanese, the true geniuses behind the world of video games. Pah, I throw my scorn upon such incompetents of the West who would mock the true art of the Japanese with "games" such as Baldur's Gate and Madden. Perhaps the West is not as intelligent as the East, but this is a matter for another day. Japan has given us such masterpieces as the Final Fantasy series, Star Ocean, Wild Arms, and of course, Arc the Lad. Yes, some of the finest vidcons in the world were created by the Japanese. I come to you today to ask you in all earnesty, what is your favorite vidcon? I will reveal mine after the grand debate has illustriously begun, but not before the first poster falls victim to my plot of discussion.

review:
[h1]Comentario RobÃ³tico-AnalÃ­tico: "MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies"[/h1]

Toda la profundidad de este tÃ­tulo radica en la customizaciÃ³n, y su encanto es propio del carisma de la franquicia; MÃ¡s allÃ¡ de eso, este juego no es particularmente bueno ni recomendable.

Los escenarios son muy grandes pero carecen de detalle, el combate es tan bÃ¡sico como lo esperable de un Hack'n Slash de Neptunia y los bosses se manejan con patrones muy sencillos de comprender y vencer.

No cuenta con muchos puntos positivos, como ya dije antes una de sus virtudes es el encanto de la franquicia y sus personajes. Ser un juego de Neptunia es su mayor virtud y aunque tampoco lo llamarÃ­a un mal juego, amerita la inexistente opciÃ³n de "[b]RecomendaciÃ³n Intermedia[/b]" que a Steam le hace falta.

Cuanto menos es divertido y permite desconectar la cabeza un rato.

[b]Â¿En conclusiÃ³n?[/b] Nada del otro mundo. Solamente recomendable para fanÃ¡ticos de la franquicia o gente que interesada en Ã©sta.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048980407', 'num_games_owned': 2513, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 437, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 405, 'last_played': 1478037780}
review:
[h1]Entering the Nepiverse[/h1]

Going into MegaTagmension (MT) as a newcomer to the Neptunia series, I was thinking that I would be playing some sort of visual novel with hyper-sexualized content under a metaphorical cloak of story progression. Or maybe something with such prolific fan service that I'd have to worry about someone walking in through the door. Little did I know that I was getting myself thrust into a world bathed in 14 different flavors of cuteness. Maybe I've been playing way too many outlandish anime games, but this VN fused with action elements managed to show such a refreshing sense of originality and style that I couldn't help but swoon at its characters. At its core, MT is a fully voiced VN with a little bit of beat em up/hack & slash thrown in, not too dissimilar to the Dynasty Warriors/Musou series. These battle sequences are relatively short and aim to enhance the story's sense of credibility, but ultimately plays a backseat role in expanding Idea Factoryâ€™s Neptunia universe.

In this newest release, a small band of girls who seemingly represent their entire academic population are uniting to save their school, Gamicademi, from closing down. In the opening scene, Blanc overhears her sisters being attacked by ghoulish zombies. To her surprise, the zombies are actually actors cast by Neptune in an effort to create a high profile movie with the hopes that it'll be the school's saving grace. Naturally, Blanc decides to join in on the fun and direct the movie herself; however, in a rather ludicrous turn of events real zombies end up getting involved, even if they are neglected between shoots. It is now up to these heavily equipped Powerpuffs to make sure Gamicademi lives to see its grand return to the spotlight.

[h1]MegaTag-Teaming[/h1]

Now saving Gamicademi may be of the utmost importance to Blanc, but some part of me did not allow myself to proceed without first changing all of the girls' outfits to their torn counterpartsâ€¦ Moving on, I began to notice important personalization options other than cute costumes and accessories. Japanese and English voice options are available, to my surprise, helping me solidify my stance to support the original dubbing. For the non-purists out there, the English VAs are actually much better than the average folk employed in domestic dubs, and I even found it to be less cringy and sensual than usual. Either way, I definitely liked the ability to pick audio languages, and feel a need to commend whoever was responsible for that decision. Delving further, MT also lets players have a choice in who they cast for each scene event or fight. This ends up creating "alternate cuts" depending on who you cast, as the resulting scene's dialogue and special events system follow your decisions to an extent. This responsibility puts you in Blanc's shoes, creating the story direction of your choosing in a much more immersive manner.

Regarding MT's Warriors/Musou-like combat system, various aspects regarding its design makes it to be the weakest mechanic of the game. Really poor camera tracking impedes fluid movement and makes positioning more difficult than it should be. Worse is when there is a boss around that can fly and perform diving maneuvers, compounding to create a slightly debilitating combat experience. Furthermore, most of these battle sequences will be completed within a handful of minutes, requiring very little variability to overcome. As the game progresses, combat ever so slowly feels like tedious exercises in mindless button mashing. Itâ€™s a big shame since advanced maneuvers are incorporated, such as taking advantage of animation cancelling, invincibility frames, or aerial combo strings for evasion, but they arenâ€™t necessary at all to beat the game. MT's tag-team mechanics, plentiful amount of unlockable combos, and visually appealing SP/EXE Drive skills help make up for the combat's grievances and keep these portions slightly enjoyable, just much less than ideal. 

MTâ€™s combat oriented multiplayer aspect seems to be the gameâ€™s biggest wow-factor when comparing it to other Nep titles, as MT is the only game so far to contain such a system. The ability to group up with 3 other players online in a mode featuring new enemies, bosses, arenas, and VN events not seen in the campaign, add major play value. There are tons of quests separated by Star difficulty, providing rewards and experience to level up character stats that carry over to the story mode. Also, unlike story mode, the multiplayer aspect unlocks every character and transformation from the beginning for use, along with changing some of the combat controls to incorporate online player joint attacks. Strangely, I found the multiplayer mode really enjoyable, even while playing solo along with the fact that the multiplayer combat system is the same as the story modeâ€™s system. Itâ€™s most likely attributed to the lengthier and tougher quest challenges, unimpeded by tiny segments of dialogue. Unfortunately, MTâ€™s multiplayer mode seems to have been plagued with connection issues for many players ever since launch, but since I havenâ€™t seen any such problems myself, the only experience I have in multiplayer is a fairly positive one.

[h1]Complete Walkthrough Playlist[/h1]

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tfeYOnddkgk&index=2&list=PLeavCsRFiP55DgIS7mFpBKiRL5C7RXB9u 

[h1]Verdict[/h1]

Although the story was a bit absurd, it seems to be what defines the style of the Neptunia games. Plenty of funny jabs at the girlsâ€™ own ridiculous situations closely flirt around breaking the fourth wall creating a neat sense of relatability, and Blancâ€™s â€œextortionâ€ scheme in obtaining MagiGirl Idolâ€™s support is comically hilarious. What started off strong ended up petering out throughout the second half of the game, as the story essentially kept walking around in circles without introducing any real major changes. A new character here or there with a backstory blended in with something zombie related is the extent of MTâ€™s narrative. Itâ€™s a bit of a shame since the game is much shorter than its RPG sister titles; so stretching MTâ€™s story thin is pretty problematic. Worse is the alternating nature of the VN and battle sequences. When you get involved with the VNâ€™s story, youâ€™re forced to fight 2 minute battles, just to watch a 2 minute dialogue and repeat the process (up to four or five times in one scene with multiple loading screens for each transition). Itâ€™s hard to get attached to either aspect when the game switches gears so often. 

Regardless, as a casual fan of anime and visual novels, I didn't find the newest installment in the Neptunia series too eccentric to take in, or alienating as an entry point. There weren't too many inside jokes or references, and the iconic song and dance summarizing previous important world aspects is present. After wrapping things up with Blanc and friends, I still found myself wanting to delve more into their world, especially as I only seemed to have observed them in such a confined environment. If you are a long-time Neptunia fan, Iâ€™m afraid that my verdict may not be very enlightening or relatable from my perspective. Just know that MT is much, much, shorter than the main series games. But for those that are weary of this as an entry point into the series, I can say that MT seemed to be rather welcoming, and is definitely enjoyable as a VN experience all on its own. There is a desire for improvements in the combat realm, but the multiplayer and VN aspects proved to be commendable enough to make checking out MT, or at least other Neptunia games, rewarding, especially during one of Idea Factoryâ€™s deep publisher sales.

review:
While the game is by no means awful, it's by no means good or memorable. It's a typical arena brawler with good controls but it offers nothing more then button mashing controls. I have played through the remake of the orginal game offered here on Steam and while there offered a lot of chram and parody to a bunch of embarassing moe fan service, this only offers fan service has the story is not funny (outside of a scene involving Blanc humilating Noire over an embarassing youtube video the game is simply not funny). The only memorable thing is that every speical move done in this game often times leads to a liften skirt or dress to expose the girls panties (Nepgear does this a lot) 

full review here

review: The game itself is pretty good, but be careful when buying.  For some people there's a bug when you open the shop in story mode that causes the game to crash.  The devs knew about this and claimed that they were fixing it, but from what I can tell they never did.  I had this issue with my old computer but not my new one, so I'm changing my review.  If you come across this bug then you might as well refund the game, as I doubt the devs will take the time to fix it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262496475', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1286, 'last_played': 1534890068}
review:
read and decide for yourself.

So, what is this game? A hack'em slash'em with neptunia characters. HDN:U with Multiplayer. That's the gist of it. It Plays a bit more like Senran Kagura Shinovi Versus than U, as the game will spawn it's enemies only from spawn points close to you, and despawn them if you go too far from them. Unlike the "Follow the Path" of SK, or the "Continue on the only obvious path"/"stay in the small arena killing things until the objective is completed" of U, most of the time you go on maps hunting for bosses, who are even denoted on your minimap!

Now, for the enemies changed from U:

Aztec Golems have a jump attack, and are more aggressive.
Kupokitties are less hyperactive.
No robot enemies
Zombies that throw their head as boomerangs
"Flying disco zombies" that shoot hellfire rockets at you, very slowly.
New Large bosses:
-Temdinkale is a one-handed sword fighter with okay mobility and a fun to fight moveset
-Megadonkale is a red dual-wielder with TONS of mobility, a pain to melee, since even his dodges damage you
-Doomkale wields a hammer, is slow as hell, and is badass.
-Undead Cannoneer lugs around two huge guns, and has spectral gauntlets to slap you around with in close range.
-the two Mariwogus-types are large fenrir-type dogs with launchable frisbee weapons, four per doggy. They have high mobility.
-Truenail and it's clone type are big walking birds with a glowy tail ending in a christmas tree light.

Unlike Nep U, you no longer map your skills to specific buttons, but instead always have four skills available.

Like Nep U, and SK, the camera control is abysmal, and needs a specific autohotkey script to be convenient with a mouse.

The multiplayer is a pathetic joke, no real communication (no chat, there is picking up phrases from a phrasebook), no real steam integration, dead game is dead tier lobbies, few games, often someone's either playing with a low-level character who dies in two hits, or a high level murdermachine kitted out in invincibility patches, high def, keep patch, life steal patch, who can steamroll bosses without thinking... Best of all, enemies scale up in HP and Damage with more players, so playing solo mp is easier. Go figure!

And as usual with IF, the game is a buggy wreck. It can lock up when looking for multiplayer servers, it can lock up before the menu, it WILL lock up (not responding) if any application asks for permission to change things in the computer.

The missions are no brainers in story mode, loading times are large.

So all in all I can't wholeheartedly recommend this game. Get it if you are interested in playing with one character or another (I've come for plutia, and you know how she doesn't leave anyone until she's satisfied :D ), get it if it's in the bargain bin, don't get it for full price.

And if you really need some action hack'em slash'em and you haven't played diablo 2 yet, do yourself a favor and get that game. For two thirds of the price you get the base game and the expansion. The ability to play in either classic mode or expansion mode, which are two wholly different experiences. Deep itemization and high amount of character customization allow you to play the way you want (Aside from a few caveats). Battle.net is a wonderful place to be (if you can avoid the bots) and you can even activate the Perfect Gem! (sorry, inside joke)

author: {'steamid': '76561197995577440', 'num_games_owned': 290, 'num_reviews': 162, 'playtime_forever': 1776, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1712, 'last_played': 1543464289}
review:
Finally the game is fixed (mostly) from all the awful game-breaking issues it had upon release

Now the game works well i have to say im really enjoying the online mode but really wish that there were more choice for it battle wise. I know this is a vita port but i just wish that the game had more big boss monsters for the team to fight in online-mode. While what we have is good i just feel more could have been added.

Story mode is ok but honstly i find myself gettimg tired of this one for some reason (story mode i mean) im not sure if its just the silly plot or the fact im playing the game mostly on friday night around midnight as i work all week from 6am till around 4 in the afternoon and then just sleep what time i have off till friday comes..........actually yeah its probably that part 

Its a good game but i recommend getting it off ebay and steam is (as always) asking to much even on there so-called sales

author: {'steamid': '76561198086183753', 'num_games_owned': 849, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1700796796}
review:
Amazing on the Vita, an absolute NIGHTMARE on the PC. Worst port I've ever seen in my entire life. This even beats Tales of Symphonia by a mile for "worst port on Steam".

The only gameplay I get is some soundless dialogue, 1 second of background music, and a crash. No matter what mode I choose. This is unavoidable. I cannot play the actual game with my friends. They won't be expecting my money for a Victory II port if this isn't patched, because this is the most ridiculous thing. I'm way over minimum specs, so no issues there. However, with this and all of the other bugs, this is definitely not Steam ready. I don't know what the heck the beta team was thinking when they gave it an all-clear.

-1/10. Needs more sound in the main menu mini-game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025980821', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1482453351}
review:
Played prior on PSTV.

MegaTagmemtion Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies fairs averagely for its steam release. Join Blanc, Neptune & co. as they work to save a school from closing its doors by having Blanc direct & screenwrite a student zombie movie.

[b]Pros[/b]
[list]
[*]Gameplay is a tad better than Nep U
[*]1080p + 60 fps
[*]Good soundtrack
[*]Good controller support
[*]Good jokes and references alike
[*]Multiplayer is fun
[/list]

[b]Neutral[/b]
[list]
[*]Fan service isn't for everyone
[/list]

[b]Cons[/b]
[list]
[*]Multiplayer does have connection issues
[*]Longer load times than the vita version
[/list]

7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198176743546', 'num_games_owned': 250, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2035, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1573, 'last_played': 1489103356}
review:
Megatagmension Blanc + Neptune vs Zombies! ...or you can just call it Hyperdimension Blanc U

Completed 100% Achievement in 26 hours
Well, compared to other Neptunia games, that's pretty fast...

Okay, let's review this game compared to Hyperdimension Neptunia U 
Pros :
+ Moar characters! (Hell yeah Uzume!)
+ Multiplayer! (But I don't have any friends so I just use it to complete the achievements... *cry*)
+ New Art Style! (Not exactly new, but this game use Megadimension art style which is compared to Nep U is... new)
+ CPUs in School Life! (More precisely, CLUB Life)
+ Better Port! (I think.... isn't it?)
+ Menu Voices! (Finally, someone who miss me when I'm gone)
+ Less Cancer Achievements! (Finally no "ALL LILY RANK MAXED" Hell yeah!)
+ Better Equipment Setup! (We can add patches update, dark history part and accesories)
+ Yuri Sniper Uni and Magical Noirina (THE BEST PROS )
Cons :
- Multiplayer is still buggy, we can't see if the room is currenly Playing or Waiting, and region locked
- Cringest Movie Ever!
- Cancer text font from Nep U is back!
- Short, but hey we can still enjoy the buggy multiplayer, can't we?
Not sure whether it's good or bad :
? No Costume Break.... Less fanservice is good....isn't it?

Well overall this game is good and fun. It runs faster and smoother than Nep U. If you like Nep U, you'll like this one...even if you don't have friends to play with....trustme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058742831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 661, 'last_played': 1482984249}
review:
Ready for a second serving of Neptunia and Tamsoft? Idea Factory's ready to serve you more with MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies (what a mouthful!)!
This is a spiritual successor to Hyperdimension Neptunia U Action Unleashed, but this time, you're brought to the Light Novel universe known as Gamicademi, where you take control of schoolgirls fighting zombies. Yep, schoolgirls, zombies, AND Neptunia, an epic casserole we have here. Now I'm sure we've all modded Left 4 Dead 2 to include Neptunia characters and go on 4 player zombie slaying havok. This here is the real deal, you're getting the actual Nep girls fighting zombies (which are zombified monsters of Neptunia lore like the Dogoo and Super Otaku).
Just like Neptunia U, the story is rather silly, but it's a lot more interesting as it progresses. The story is that Gamicademi is closing, and as a means of saving the school, the girls must film a movie about their school, and believe it or not, zombies appear and the girls use the opportunity to make a zombie movie featuring their school. Both the movie in the making and the game's story all prove to be very silly and hilarious. It's even funnier when some of the girls go into crazy antics.
Meanwhile the gameplay is a lot like Neptunia U, but the moveset has been nerfed and reworked. The new attacks take time to get used to since now you can charge attacks and in turn makes combo stringing a lot more challenging (good luck getting 9,999 combos). You still have your horde of enemies with dumb AI at least, so they can make things more or less easy. It takes time getting used to the new schemes especially with 14 characters (another 14 with their HDD/transformed state), but it still feels fast paced and easy to pick up and play.
Missions are much shorter as well. As this is a Vita game, this was a perfect way to get your Nep on the go. And if you're using a laptop, then you'll get about the same amount of portablility and accessibility. Now the missions may be shorter, but sometimes they can be difficult especially at lower levels. At least you retain the EXP gained if you die in the apocalypse.
Another thing I like about this game is how you can put accessories in JUST ABOUT ANYWHERE. I repeat, JUST ABOUT ANYWHERE. What is this, Garry's Mod? I can cram two stackable plushies onto the same head, headphones, hats, all in the same spot. Clearly someone wanted this to be the next Hat Simulator since Team Fortress 2.
When you're done playing the singleplayer, you can tackle the game's biggest focus, the multiplayer. It's 4 player hack and slash goodness as you take on various quests like it's Monster Hunter and God Eater. I'm surprised at how stable the game's servers are in my view especially with lag free input (a friend of mine told me Tamsoft makes excellent netcoding and their Steamworks are just as good as the Vita). I sure could use a handy button to invite friends over. There's private servers that you can secure with a password, so it's something. And if you wanted to cross-platforms with Vita, no dice. Just Steam servers. But hey, Multiplayer is very fun.
In the end, this takes a lot of the fun things about Neptunia U and made it quirkier, and more fun to play. It's also zombies and schoolgirls mashed in. It seemed to me that Idea Factory saw how many L4D2 and GMOD players loved playing with Neptunia mods and wanted to make a game of its own. I had a lot of fun playing this game, and since it's the Halloween season, what a perfect time for them to bring this game to Steam. Now if only Uni learned how to do Rule No. 2: Double Tap.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106960803', 'num_games_owned': 102, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 582, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1487689589}
review:
Our long-awaited Blanc spinoff is here!

Pros:-

+Blanc!
+Uzume!
+Waifu dress up
+Pretty high FPS, even for a low-end graphics card.
+As with other Neptunia games, it's cute
+Compared to Nep U, it has an RPG-like feel, with a point allocation system
+Multiplayer, which is a first for the Nep series.

Cons:-

-Region-locked multiplay
-Opening sequence can't be skipped
-Opening sequence is stuck in a specific resolution (at least for me)
-Freezes at start if played without WiFI (again, it's probably just me)
-Somewhat lacking in Nep jokes compared to the other games
-You can't friggin move Blanc's hat (tbh annoying as f**k)

Overall: 8/10

So yeah, this game has its bugs, but if you've played the other Neptunia games, you would love it just as much. Be prepared to lose your dignity though (But if you've already played the other games, you would probably have lost most of it already). Enjoy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307903608', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 1605, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1583, 'last_played': 1476754430}
review: This game is a great game! I love the characters and the gameplay. However, the reason why I cannot recommend this game to anyone at the moment is because the online is terrible. Sometimes I try to search for a room aaaaaaaannnnnnd it crashes. Try to join a room? Crashes. Its very frustrating...sometimes when I DO get a chance to play online I get these weird hair glitches that obstruct my view making io hard to find where the enemies are. Another glitch that is really annoying is the "Player joined player left" notification that wont go away until you actually leave the room. Other than that the game is really addicting. You can grind to level 99 relatively easy. I will probably update my review as time goes on. I really hope they fix the multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198142428054', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1866, 'last_played': 1481289490}
review:
It's not really that different from Neptunia U so if you liked that game you're surely going to like this too; if you are familiar with the Neptunia franchise and you like their kind of stories you'll probably like this game too for the same reason.
It is that kind of game after all; a musou-styled Neptunia game with their funny stories, lovable character and strangely addicting gameplay.
Now with multiplayer included.
And Blanc as a protagonist.
And Bert as a possible recycle bin.
And Magical No... Nothing. I said nothing.

Pros:
+ The story is funny
+ The characters are awesome as always
+ The general gameplay is fun
+ It has multiplayer now and it was something I really would wanted in the U game
+ They put really a lot of details in the voice chat, there are even catchphrases of the single characters or the unique calling ways they have to each other
+ I... Honestly liked there wasn't the clothing damage system of the U game (But that could be just me...)
+ Uzume ** (But that could be just me...)

Cons:
- That's probably one of the shortest Neptunia game I ever played, probably done this way to add the multiplayer though
- There isn't an extra after played the story (I really liked the Neptral Tower and the Gamindustri Gauntlet of the U)
- Multiplier is present but still a little bit bugged, it's not that easy to connect with other people even though there are servers
- I honestly think the combos in the U game were better thought and more connectible to do combos. (But that could be just me...)

author: {'steamid': '76561198207073739', 'num_games_owned': 476, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 823, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 412, 'last_played': 1618836395}
review:
MegaTagmenion Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies. A new spin-off game of the Neptunia franchise, based on the same system as Neptunia U and of course develloped by the same team. Just like Noire got her own game, this one has Blanc as a main character, even though Neptune is present throughout the entire game. When will a Vert-only game come out?

But let's now evaluate the game.

The gameplay :

If you have played Nep U and got the mechanics right, it will not be hard to play MegaTagmension, as it is also a Hack-N-Slash. Although, a few changes are visible. The commands are a little bit different, and if you play with a keyboard you might wanna go through the settings to re-assignate some keys. Goodbye to the torn-off duds caused by the monsters, and goodbye to the Nepbull released by monsters. Now, if you wanna heal during battle, you have to buy items and equip them. New ennemies, and a new way to improve your characters using "Ability points" that you gain through leveling. No medals anymore, but instead treasure pieces (in fact consoles) that let you unlock new outfits. You can also by accessories and customize your characters, this can be helpful later. Overall, an easy-to-understand system. Also, if you're used to grinding in the Neptunia games, try not to grind too much. A lvl 70 character won't help you fight the last boss in an epic battle, as you need to be around lvl 40 to beat it. You don't want to kill it too easily.

The Story :

As I said earlier, this game's main protag is Blanc, our Justice goddess (No, Blanc, that was a praise, put that hammer down! ). Our 8 Gamindustri rulers (Yes, I put the Candidates as rulers) have enrolled in Gamicademy, a school situated on an island in the center of Gamindustri, so that anybody from any country can join. They have joined this school to understand humans better and help their people. But when they hear that the academy is gonna close because of a lack of students, Neptune don't hesitate to do anything she can to save it and bring more students. The story itself is pretty entertaining, our 4th-wall breaks are still here and some scenes are an hommage to the community. The time completion may depend on your will to end the game fast or not. For me, it took 8 hours, and I haven't "fully" completed the game as there are some scenes that can only be unlocked via certain conditions (But in-game hints can help you unlock them). A whole lot of characters from the different games, as well as a new character brought by the constant wish of the Devs to put themselves in the game : Tamsoft. The same way IF and Compa represents Idea Factory and Compile Heart (And don't forget our dungeon helper Stella, representing FelliStella), Tamsoft represents... Well, Tamsoft, they didn't bother trying to change the name, which is not completely a bad thing. She's a rather strong character and can become useful in some fights. (She even have a transformation).

The Multiplayer :

Remember earlier, when I told you about customizing your characters? Well, it is mainly because there's a brand-new multiplayer mode, allowing you to take on quests with up to 3 other people. The quests aren't related to the main game, and the Multiplayer has in fact it's own story, and can take some time to complete. You will even be able to play directly with the HDD form of a character, while another player uses it's normal form. (It happened to me, I was playing as Purple Heart while somebody else was playing as Neptune, and we cleared bosses with an excessive amount of Neptune Break). You can choose wether to use a save from the Story mode, keeping your lvls, or you can start with a brand-new save only for Multiplayer and work your way from lvl 1 to lvl 99.

Issues :

I have only noticed a few issues :
-Whenever I start the game, I have to wait 5-10 minutes before reaching the main menu. I suspect this is because I don't have the perfect configuration.
-Sometimes, in multiplayer, people might try to join while you're doing a quest, which may results in endlees loops of : <Player> has joined, <Player> has left, <Player> has joined, <Player> has left, etc...

So this concludes my review of this game. A rather good spin-off that doesn't deviate from the franchise, a good story, a good gameplay and very few issues. For me, I give this game a 9.5/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198020798482', 'num_games_owned': 266, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 70, 'last_played': 1524931261}
review:
I would love to recommend this because I am a big fan of the franchise, but unfortunately I cannot do that, not for the full price at least.

MegaTagmension is a musou style game (like Dynasty Warriors) while the promise and potential is good, the problem is that the whole game consists of very short scenes in which you fight just 1 pack of monsters. The most gameplay you will get in a row is about 3 minutes.  This is NOT a game in which you traverse large levels with monster packs, bosses, complete objectives etc. You load the scene, kill 20 mobs, and that's it. I haven't completed it yet, but the whole thing can probably be completed in about 3-4 hours tops. Of course there is some replayability thanks to leveling, lily ranks, treasures gathering and such.

Most of the time is spent in menus and reading dialogue cutscenes, which are funny and interesting as always in the Neptunia games, but when you have to spend 5 minutes reading dialogues to get 2 minutes of action it kind of kills the fun.

If you are a hardcore Neptunia fan, it will still be fun of course. Though I would suggest waiting for a sale. This game just isn't worth 30â‚¬.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055364818', 'num_games_owned': 776, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1256, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1161, 'last_played': 1492443487}
review: Fuck Blanc, we have Pururut and Neptune

author: {'steamid': '76561198125309957', 'num_games_owned': 169, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 498, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 468, 'last_played': 1476302953}
review:
+1 IDK what everyone is complaining about so much for? unlike all the other neptunia games on steam this port actually seems better as I did not even have to edit .ini files or change compatibility settings to get it to go fullscreen at 1920 x 1080 resolution but if you are having a problem with getting resolution or fullscreen to work try out this general fix for neptunia games below (fixes the main neptune games at least as every single neptunia game on steam has problems):

all you do is right click the game in library then go to properties then go to local files and right click the application thing (should have a picture of one of the characters so easy to find) then go all the way down to properties and hit compatibility tab then if you have windows 10 like me put the game in compatibility mode for windows 7 (windows 8 or xp1 might work too) then look at bottom of page under settings and click "disable display scaling" and "run as administrator" then hit the apply button and play game! and enjoy some more of our beloved NEP NEP!!!

this site might help too: http://www.chaoshour.com/articles/fixes/megatagmension-steam-broken-faulty-crashing-freezing-loading-screen-problem-bugs-glitches-fix

but to get on with my review, i have every single neptunia game except the spin-offs so i figured after seeing this on steam that I should give it a shot and so far I am glad I did! This neptunia game unlike the main games has a more Dynasty warriors style of combat (which I enjoy its a nice change) and it is quite fun!! the ability to pick and use any character is cool especially considering the co-op which is unique. The music is cool and the comedy has not yet dissapointed me! This is classic nep-nep so if you dare call yourself a nepper you will buy this game on ps vita and steam NOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! (ANGRY BLANC VOICE)

I love nep-nep i honestly will buy any neptunia product just because the characters are so awesome and hilarious (though the nep sisters come first!!)

EDIT: now that I have completed the game and got my fill of nep I can say for sure that this is a great neptunia game its the first spin-off game of the series that i have actually bought it does not have anywhere near as long of a story or content as the main games have though but thats to be expected right? other than the really short storyline and lack of content for replay value i thouroughly enjoyed this experience like any other neptunia game I definetly recommend you buy it if you find a good sale on the game

review:
PROS:
- BLANC'S THE MAIN PROTAGONIST!
- Tamsoft, and new playable characters
- Equipping headphones on Nep's legs :)
- Improved combo system

CONS:
- Multiplayer </3
- Overly-large maps

Maybe those future updates (hopefully) make this port a better one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013855113', 'num_games_owned': 358, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2126, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2052, 'last_played': 1582417391}
review:
This is by far my favorite Neptunia gam simply 'cause Blanc's the main character!
The gameplay took some time getting used to, but i've gotten the hang of it now. 

You'll like this if you like:
++Neptunia, especially Blanc.
++ Neptunia: Action Unleashed like gameplay, with insanely fun Boss Battles in the multiplayer mode.
++ Multiplayer. A first time for a Nep game, but i think it's implemented very well. (Still a bit buggy at the time of writing)
++ The story is your typical Neptunia lighthearted stuff, with the addition of a school setting and zombies... so win/win.

So go ahead and get it!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981543135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 233, 'playtime_forever': 917, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 917, 'last_played': 1476122970}
review:
MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies est un beat'em all du meme style que Hyperdimension Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. Alors que je n'avais pas aimÃ© ce dernier pour sa grosse rÃ©pÃ©titivitÃ© et l'absence de contenu, j'ai prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© ce nouveau spin-off.
Il y a eu quelques amÃ©liorations surtout au niveau du scÃ©nario trÃ¨s orientÃ© humour, le systÃ¨me de mÃ©dailles a Ã©tÃ© enlevÃ© (ouf!) et les combats sont un peu plus interessants avec quelques attaques a esquiver sur les plus gros monstres.
Certes il reste assez limitÃ© surtout sur le contenu, sa manque de quÃªtes, d'armes et accessoires. Attendez vous a une dizaine d'heures pour la "story" en ayant grind un peu, sa fait peu mais le jeu reste plaisant avec les diffÃ©rents personnages de la sÃ©rie et quelques nouveau (mention spÃ©ciale pour Tamsoft qui est pour moi le perso le plus interessant a jouer).

A prendre en promo si vous etes apprÃ©ciÃ© la sÃ©rie et aimÃ© le genre sinon passez votre chemin, il y a mieux en beat'em all!


Points positifs :
-Personnages Ã©quilibrÃ©s et emblÃ©matique de la sÃ©rie.
-PossibilitÃ© de placer les accessoires comme on veut (positionement dans l'espace).
-PrÃ©sence d'un multijoueur avec des quetes inÃ©dites (faisable en solo).


Points nÃ©gatifs : 
-Les programmes a mettre sur les armes ont un certaine durabilitÃ©, ils faut en acheter/craft plusieurs du coup. Dans ce cas la pourquoi ne pas les avoir fait permanent?
-Niveau trop court en gÃ©nÃ©ral, sa se plie en quelques secondes pour le dÃ©but du moins.
-Jeu globalement trop facile.
-Certains personnages ont des combos beaucoup trop simples et si on a pas dÃ©bloquÃ© toutes les "techniques" ils sont vite ennuyant a jouer.
-Le lock est a revoir : il est trÃ¨s imprÃ©cis, la camÃ©ra est trop zoomÃ© et on le perds quand on se transforme.
-Chargement dans le menu ou on peut customiser et lancer les missions du jeu un peu long malgrÃ© que le jeu soit sur SSD.
-Peu d'armes, acessoires un peu limitÃ©s et grind complÃ©tement RNG sur les "trÃ©sors" et les "Processors/Dark history parts", c'est infame comme systeme !
-Il manque une liste avec ce qu'on peut avoir sur telle scÃ¨nes ou monstres, sur internet celle ci n'ont pas Ã©tÃ© mis a jour pour la version PC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089219484', 'num_games_owned': 333, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1036, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 73, 'last_played': 1515318393}

Probably shouldn't really go into detail, this isn't a bug report thing.

Anyway. I like this game already and hope they fix the bugs and crashes. This game can really evolve into something great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025336554', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1476048547}
review:
Had 4 friends all purchase this game on a whim. Within 30 minutes of struggling to get multiplayer to work the game crashed at least 4 times each. In the end the game tossed me into servers with other people, even though I was connecting to a password protected lobby. 

Too much of a hastle, my friends and I just modded Left 4 Dead until it was indistinguishable from this game. Not only was that cheaper, but much more fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980389571', 'num_games_owned': 1312, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 167, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1520442453}
review:
Oof. I'm a big fan of the Neptunia series but this game is in a rough place. Great cast of characters, and I'm excited to finally have a Nep action game where I can play Uzume, but the camera controls are in a rough place and the gameplay is very anemic. Where I've already put 25 hours into Nep U, I'm not sure I'll break 15 on this. Multiplayer may add some staying power, but it's currently not working reliably.

I'm hoping IFI takes care of business and I'm able to flip this review, but for now, if you don't have either, buy Hyperdimension Neptunia U instead of this game. It plays like this game should, and has much more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079551448', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2113, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2108, 'last_played': 1479001146}
review:
I am a simple man.
I see NepNep.
I like it.

+ Fun Story.
+ Multiplayer.
+ Improvement from Unleashed.
+ Good Musics.
+ Hack and Slash.

- Multiplayer still buggy.
- Costume Break?
- Compa and IF (they become a shopkeeper, not a playable character)
- Short Story. Maybe because they focused on Multiplayer.

Overall for NepNep Lover, this is a recommended game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161574225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 943, 'last_played': 1475995314}
review:
Nice game!

The missions take usually about 30-60 seconds and only boss fights can take more time.

Before you play you must know:

-	game is like U: action only the camera control can be tricky some time as you fight a 6-7 times bigger enemy so prepare to see mostly only the legs of the bosses.
-	the story is the least good of all Neptune game, but if you liked the other games you will like this as well
-	Multiplayer it sill buggy as I write this but I could get in teams at least a couple of times so later it will surely get better(and you can do multiplayer fight alone as well)
-	 the humour and style is the same as before
-	Uni and some other character attack style changed so you cannot own all enemy so easily with them like beforeâ€¦ thatâ€™s  great because some of them was to over powered (and some still remain, but thatâ€™s not bad)
So if you liked U: Action you will love this to and will make you wait for the next game!

review:
If you like Neptunia U, you'll love this game. Good improvemnts over U, with in depth customization and well balanced characters (Well, except for Iris Heart).

However, the Multiplayer is kind of broken, seeing that it's region locked and that almost no one is online.
Oh, and did I forget to mention the crashes?

author: {'steamid': '76561198017087470', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 1165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 404, 'last_played': 1511395459}
review:
Did you like Nep U? if you didn't then this isn't for you either. If you haven't played Nep U then this a basic third person action game that was first released on the Vita as such the levels short and the gameply basic as it made with playing on the go in mind.

If you have never played a Nep game before I personally would play Rebirth One first as thats a much better way to get to know the CPU's.

If you did like Nep U then Blanc vs the zombies is a better more polished version of that with multiplayer online co-op and this time the enemys are more active with some of the larger mobs having skills you actully have to watch out for and dodge. Plus this time the cloths dont break which I regard as a good thing though you might not.

On the technical side of things at the time of writing this review some people (including me) are having issues where you have to play windowed at 720P (cant change) or you just get a black screen, Though if you do play in a winow is runs flawlessly. So check to community hub before you buy if thats the sort of thing to put you off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198095452255', 'num_games_owned': 240, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 2145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1843, 'last_played': 1674062721}
review:
I've played this game a lot and I enjoy it personally but even then... I do have a few gripes with it... especially Multiplayer.

Now, my computer is bad and some missions lag so I have to go solo (Besides, I enjoy the multiplayer bosses solo) but if someone was to join, it basically says "Haha! No, you can't beat the quest now and are stuck after the last 10 seconds until the person leaves. Why isn't there a 'loner' option for multiplayer where the room is created but no-one other than you can enter it? Would help out a lot in the case of online grinding as online is needed for achievements...

Furthermore, multiplayer rooms are SERIOUSLY needing some updating in password department as despite me putting in a random number password, people sometimes get lucky (Or the password means nothing and gets removed when the room is created. Again, needs updating) and enter which again, causes the game to not finish off the multiplayer mission unless they leave before the timer at the end runs out.

If your playing solo and in single player, get the game even though it is short. If for multiplayer, I suggest to stay away until we get a patch and better password systems as it is ridiculous right now (I just want my 2x Megadonkle quest complete!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198167779433', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 5420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2068, 'last_played': 1525615115}
review:
It's Neptunia U with new maps, new enemies, and just three more characters. Overall it's the same. Apparently Neptunia U has more content, sad(If you want to know how I criticize Neptunia U please check my profile).

[strike]The only charm on this game, multiplayer, doesn't work. Everytime I try to join it crashes.

Good job IFI, Good job. Hope you fix this ASAP.

*If someone try multiplayer and it works please tell me. I'll try some more.*[/strike] It works now and I enjoyed it a lot and recommended for someone who wants multiplayer. But still not recommended overall because lack of single player content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008926167', 'num_games_owned': 1549, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 139, 'last_played': 1477685550}
review:
MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies breathes new life into the series by taking the game in a completely different direction from the standard JRPG route, and instead builds upon what was learned in Neptunia U: Action Unleashed. A solid character action game with fun gameplay throughout and a multiplayer mode that adds a lot of value to the game. Full review can be found here: http://www.keengamer.com/article/14309_megatagmension-blanc-neptune-vs-zombies-review

Pros/Cons
 + Very fun to play, great combat with some depth	 - No graphics options to speak of
 + Cheap on launch, good value for the buyer	 - Writing is very similar in style to previous games
 + Multiplayer with up to three other people	 - Occasional funky enemy spawns
 + Deluxe DLC doesn't take away from the game at all

author: {'steamid': '76561198174657626', 'num_games_owned': 388, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 1951, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1178, 'last_played': 1516802241}
review:
MegaTagmension Blanc + Neptune VS Zombies is a great spinoff of the Neptunia series. It's very similar to Hyperdimension Neptunia U : Action Unleashed for it's hack and slash genre and that this installment features co-op multiplayer!

However, in regards to playable content, I find this one lacking compared to NepU, NepU has more quests I believe and afterwards you would have to complete the tournaments + Neptral tower if you were aiming for 100% achievements, NepU provides much more play. With MegaTagmension, after finishing the 12 acts, you'll have to resort to multiplayer to get 100% and it's pretty much more quests and luck to get certain items. A few things that I do like is the accessories in the game, all accessories are avaiable to all characters and do not require multiple purchases if multiple characters are going to wear the same thing. I also like how you can adjust the position/placements of the accessories. And of course, I liked how Uzume, Plutia and Peashy are in this game along with the new character, Tamsoft.

I do have some cons about the game. Firstly, the game's consistency. I feel as though the game may be a bit too easy especially when you decide to do a "YOLO" with a character at level 8 on a mission that recommends level 25-30 (Around there) and you are still able to beat it despite being underlevelled by almost 3-4 times, if not more. Then again, for players who love a good challenge, this may be a downside. For me, I personally don't mind.
With multiplayer, I do hope there is a patch in the future that may fix some possible issues such as players joining MP games that are password protected. I am willing to play game with another player but when I set a password protected MP, I set it because I want to do solo MP for achievements and so, it'd be nice if players would stop randomly joining my password protected rooms somehow XD

Would I Nepping Neppemend This Game?
Yes, Nepping Yes (I'm Neptunia trash, so this opinion is very biased)
Though if I were to rate it honestly out of 10, I'd say 7/10 or maybe around 6.8/10 xS

review:
Despite the fact that I'm running this game on my total wooden pc, this game ran incredibly well and not-that-much lag! 
From my experience, this game is a great spin-off with tons and tons of sillinesses from the characters except from our best Nep-nep.

My Multiplayer experience isn't that bad as the other players aren't in the same country as me, it has the lag sometimes since my internet speed is about averange and my wooden pc is really slow and old (hasn't change since the last 5 years).

This game is awesome!
I gave it Nep/Nep! (Not 9/11 though.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198051962026', 'num_games_owned': 351, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 6192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5700, 'last_played': 1585181946}
review:
It's pretty much Neptunia U but with original maps, new enemies, new soundtrack, +3 more playable characters.

The region lock in multiplayer still exists but they fixed a lot of critical issues that makes multiplayer enjoyable once again.

Also, the minimum requirements are misleading seeing that I can play at 60fps with a Core 2 Quad and a Radeon HD 4670 512MB video card from 2008.

Nepsword:-

review:
Can't reccomend this Neptune, I love Neptune series, but this port is the WORSE.
LLOONNGG loadings times, and it's installed in SSD with Raid 0,
fullscreen drops fps to 15~20, change to borderless solves this, but each time

and response after 10 seconds or so.
And the Deluxe Pack have only english voices, ringtones and windows theme.
Haven't test multiplayer yet.
